And of course you can also add your own logo image instead of using the default site title, by uploading your logo image (max. width 200px) to the Custom Header. For further options like Custom CSS, font changes and more custom color options you can buy the Custom Design upgrade.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The standard content width for Posts and Pages is 720.
  2. Standard post featured images should be at least 720 and max. 1070.
  3. Featured images for sticky posts should have a width of 1070.
  4. Featured images of posts featured in the slider should be 1070 x 600.
  5. Max. width of logo image: 200.

picks.name: Staff Picks
picks.description: Determines which themes are shown in the "Choose a theme" step during signup.

stay.name: Stay
stay.author: Automattic
stay.description: Designed with hotels, inns, and bed & breakfasts in mind, Stay is the perfect theme for property owners. Take advantage of its Room and Testimonial post types, home page template, large imagery, and minimal layout to show off to potential guests.
stay.description_long:
Designed with hotels, inns, and bed & breakfasts in mind, Stay is the perfect theme for property owners. Take advantage of its Room and Testimonial post types, home page template, large imagery, minimal layout, and responsive design to show off your property to your guests.

Home Page Template

To set up Stay’s Home page template and Slider:

  1. Create a new page named “Home” (or a different name of your choice) and assign it the Home template under Page Attributes.
  2. Go to Settings → Reading  in your dashboard and select your new “Home” page as the static front page. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click Save Changes.
  3. If you previously had a header image on your site’s home page, remove the header image: featured images and header images will interfere with the Slider. To remove the header image navigate to Appearance → Header and click Remove Header Image. Scroll to the bottom of the page and click Save Changes.
  4. Set Featured Images for all of the pages you would like to appear in the Slider. To do this, navigate to the edit screen for each page, go to the Featured Image module on the right of the screen, and add a Featured Image for the page. Featured Images need to be at least 960px wide to appear in the slider. Click Update to save changes.
  5. Navigate to the Home Slider section of your Customizer. Select up to 6 pages with attached Featured Images of at least 960 px in width. Click Save.
  6. Content on the home page will be full-width, between the Slider and Home Widget areas.
  7. The three optional Home Widget areas can be set up in Appearance → Widgets.

Widget Areas

Stay has 8 widget areas from which to choose. A header widget area, three optional widget areas on the home page template, and then primary and (optional) secondary widget areas for both pages and posts. On pages, the primary widget area is to the left of the content while the secondary widget area is to the right. On posts, both widget areas are to the right of the content. Widget areas can be setup in Appearance → Widgets.

If you sign up for your site through the Hotels landing page, a Reservation Widget will be available. Use it to add a reservation inquiry form to widget areas.

Custom Menus

Stay has a single, primary custom menu area below the header, and an optional secondary menu that appears beside the header widget area. Custom Menus can be set up by going to Appearance → Menus. Note that the secondary menu only supports one level (no submenus).

Rooms and Testimonials

Add rooms and testimonials to your site from the admin. Set a rate for your guests, tag your room with its Amenities, and add a featured image for the Room page template. Create a page and assign it the Rooms Template to display a listing of all of your rooms.

Populate testimonials and display them by giving a page the Testimonials Template.

Social Links

To show the social network links in the footer of your site, define the network links in the Customizer under Social Links.

Custom Header and Background

Stay features a Custom Header that can be set under  Appearance → Header. The background can also be customized under Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 920 with one active sidebar and 610 with two.
  2. The primary and secondary sidebars on posts and pages are 250 wide.
  3. The Full Width page template is 1200 wide.
  4. The featured page slider image size is at least 960 wide.
  5. Individual post featured image is at least 920 wide.

suburbia.name: Suburbia
suburbia.author: WPShower
suburbia.description: Suburbia is a unique magazine theme in a minimalistic style. Designed by WPShower. It features five widget areas, custom header, and custom background.
suburbia.description_long:
Suburbia is a unique magazine theme in a minimalistic style. By activating this theme, you can easily transform your blog into a cool, attractive online magazine.

Featured Post

With Suburbia, you can enlarge and feature your most important posts by marking them as Sticky posts.

Custom Header Image

Add a personal stamp to your online magazine! Suburbia allows you to upload a custom logo for your site as a Custom Header Image in Appearance → Header.

Widgets

Suburbia supports five widget optional areas — four in the footer and one in the sidebar in single post and page views.

Custom Appearance

Make it yours with the Custom Background feature, Custom Menus, and a full-width template.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 547 except in the full-width layout, where it’s 744.
  2. Widget width is 155.
  3. The custom header image is 155 by 155 (width, height).
  4. The featured image works best with images at least 350 by 248 (width, height).

hustle-express.name: Hustle Express
hustle-express.author: WooThemes
hustle-express.description: A freshly designed, open and responsive blogging theme designed by WooThemes.
hustle-express.description_long:
Hustle Express is a freshly designed, spacious, clean styling and responsive blogging theme. This theme has plenty of white space to help focus a user’s attention on your content.

Easy to Customize

Hustle Express comes with the option to customize the header and the background that make it easy to fit Hustle Express to your site’s personality.

Hustle has plenty of white space to help focus a user’s attention on your content, and with circular placeholders for your post imagery it really adds a level of polish to your post displays.

Two Customizable Menus

Hustle Express also has two menu areas: a traditional page menu and a second (optional) top menu. You can take control of these two areas in Appearance → Menus by creating your own custom menus and assigning them to either menu location.

Post Formats

Enhance your site with Post Formats by displaying various types of content. Hustle Express includes support for the Aside, Image, Video, Quote, Link and Chat Post Formats.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 638.
  2. The sidebar width is 340.

typo.name: Typo
typo.author: Okay Themes
typo.description: A typography-centered, responsive theme for photos, articles, quotes, videos, and more. Its sleek one-column design makes it perfect for a personal blog, and support for multiple post formats allows you to tumblelog your finds with style.
typo.description_long:
With clean typography, an inky color palette, and lots of subtle textures, Typo has all the charm and style of an old-fashioned typewriter. The responsive, one-column design makes it perfect for writing, while support for several post formats makes it easy to share your life with a vintage flair. Read on to find out more about Typo and all its features.

Post Formats

Typo supports several Post Formats: Aside, Image, Link, Quote, Video, Audio, and Status. Each post format has a unique style to differentiate it from your standard posts. A few examples:

Image

Quote

Status

The Link post format in Typo takes the first link from your content and reformats it to the title of your post:

Link

Custom Menus

Typo includes two menu areas: A primary drop-down menu in the header and a secondary single-level menu in the footer. The Primary Menu will display a list of your pages if no Custom Menu is set under Appearance → Menus:

The Footer Menu will only display if configured under Appearance → Menus:

Widgets

You can configure up to three footer widget areas by going to Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Headers and Backgrounds

Typo allows you to set a variable-size custom header under Appearance → Header. You can also customize the theme with a background color or image by going to Appearance → Background.

Custom Header

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 615.
  2. The footer sidebar widths are 185.

runo-lite.name: Runo Lite
runo-lite.author: La&La
runo-lite.description: Runo Lite was made especially for poets and writers. It is lightweight, clean, simple, spacious, and feels like your favorite notebook, and the responsive, minimal layout looks good in every device.
runo-lite.description_long:
Runo Lite is the perfect theme for writers, poets, or anyone who wants a minimalist canvas for their content. Offering multiple sidebar configurations, custom headers, backgrounds, and menus, Runo Lite is a flexible and elegant solution for your writing needs.

Widgets

With Runo Lite, you have the option of displaying your main sidebar to the right or left of your content, or simplify and remove the main sidebar entirely. To enable the sidebar, add some widgets under Appearance -> Widgets, then go to Customizer -> Theme Options to change the placement.

You can also activate up to three additional sidebars in the footer.

Custom Header and Background

Add a personal touch to Runo Lite with a flexible custom header under Appearance -> Header. You can also change the background color or image by going to Appearance -> Background.

Custom Menu

Runo Lite supports one Primary Menu in the header, and it can be configured it by going to Appearance -> Menus.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 640
  2. The sidebar width is 231
  3. The footer sidebar widths vary depending on the screen size and number of sidebars active

selecta.name: Selecta
selecta.author: Obox Design
selecta.description: With a featured posts slider on the front page, a wide, one-column template on image and video posts, and archives displayed in gallery format, Selecta is well-suited for blogs which focus primarily on showcasing videos or images. It comes with six color schemes, support for video, image, aside, gallery, quote, chat, and audio post formats, custom header, custom background, and four widget areas — one in the left sidebar and three in the footer.
selecta.description_long:
With a featured posts slider on the front page, a wide, one-column template on image and video posts, and archives and search results displayed in gallery format, Selecta is well-suited for blogs that focus primarily on showcasing videos or images.

Featured Post Slider


Add a touch of interactivity with your blog while showing off your amazing videos and images by showcasing your Sticky Posts with the featured posts slider. Turn it on in Appearance → Theme Options. After you enable the slider, it will appear at the top of your front page once you mark at least two posts as sticky. If you have just one sticky post, that post will stand on its own at the top of the page.

Latest Posts


Let your readers see your most recent additions at a glance with the Latest Posts feature. When enabled, it will display your four latest posts in a nice row of rounded boxes just above the main content on the front page (and below the featured posts slider, if you’ve turned that on as well).

Image and Video Post Formats

Selecta was designed especially for people who wish to showcase videos and images on their blogs. To that end, when you create a post with either the video or image Post Format, the theme will display the post content in one wide column on single-post views. This allows your readers to watch and view your creations with minimal distractions.

Video Post Format
Image Post Format

Aside, Audio, Chat, Gallery, and Quote Post Formats

In addition to the video and image post formats, Selecta also applies special styling to aside, audio, chat, gallery and quote posts.

Quote Posts
Gallery Posts
Chat Posts

Audio Posts
Aside Posts

Color Schemes

Selecta lets you pick from six vibrant color options: blue (default), blue and black, red and black, green and black, sea blue and white rose. Set the color scheme in Appearance → Theme Options.

Blue (Default)
Blue and Black
Red and Black

Green and Black
Sea Blue
White Rose

Archive and Search Results Pages

Staying true to its showcase focus, Selecta arranges your archives and search results into a gallery format. The post title and date are shown along with the featured image in a nice little rounded box. If a post does not have a featured image, a short excerpt of the post content will be shown instead.

Widget Areas

Selecta comes with four widget areas — one in the left sidebar, and three in the footer. The footer widget area will appear only if you have added widgets to it.

Further Customization Options

Finally, Selecta lets you customize the appearance with a custom header image and a custom background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Front page and non image or video posts: The main content is 560 and the sidebar is 290.
  2. Video and Image Posts, and single-image view: The main column width is 940.
  3. Header image is 940 in width and 150 in height.

elemin.name: Elemin
elemin.author: Automattic
elemin.description: Elemin is a clean, minimalistic theme with great white-space balance and elegant typography. It features nine color schemes, three site layout options, two post layout options, two custom menu areas, custom link colors, support for post formats, a footer widget area, custom header, custom background, and a responsive layout that adapts to various screen sizes.
elemin.description_long:
Add a touch of sophistication and style to your blog with Elemin, a charming theme with a minimal design and elegant typography. Elemin’s simplicity makes it a great fit for many types of blogs — journals, lifestreams, photoblogs, and more.

Site Layout Options

Choose to place your primary sidebar either to the left or to the right of the main content. Or, add no widgets and enjoy a full-width layout.

Sidebar-Content Layout
Content-Sidebar Layout
Full-Width, No-Sidebars Layout

Post Layout Options

With Elemin, you can display your front page posts in either a one- or two-column configuration.

Two Column Post View with Right Sidebar
Two Column Post View, No Sidebars

Color Choices

Elemin lets you choose from nine color schemes, in two variations. You can choose to go light and delicate with white (default), blue, green, pink, and yellow. Or go bold and borderless with black, gray, orange, and bright yellow. Set the color scheme in Appearance → Theme Options.

White
Blue
Green

Pink
Yellow
Black

Gray
Orange
Bright Yellow

Custom Link Color

After you’ve settled on a color scheme, you can tweak the primary link color right from the theme options page to suit your liking.

Post Formats

Let your visitors see at a glance the type of post you’ve written using Post Formats. Elemin gives each post format a unique icon that appears beside each post’s title.

Custom Menus and Footer Widget Areas

Elemin comes with two Custom Menu areas (one in the header and the other in the footer). You can create and assign menus for these areas by going to Appearance → Menus. The footer menu area will only show  top level navigation items.

In addition to the primary sidebar, Elemin features three widget areas in the footer. These widget areas will appear when you add widgets to them.

Custom Header and Custom Background

Put the finishing touches on your blog with your own Custom Header and Custom Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Left- or right-sidebar layout, single-column post configuration: The main content is 550 and the sidebar is 260.
  2. Left- or right-sidebar layout, two-column post configuration: Each individual post column is 343 and the sidebar is 260.
  3. Full-width and attachment pages: The main content is 850.
  4. No-sidebar layout, two-column post configuration: Each individual post column is 470.
  5. Header image is 990 in width and 150 in height.

Elemin theme documentation

beach.name: Beach
beach.author: Gibbo and Automattic
beach.description: Beach brings the warm feel of Thailand’s shores to your blog year round. Originally designed for Drupal Thailand by Gibbo, Beach features special post formatting for Aside, Gallery, Quote, and Status posts, along with a beautiful secondary menu area in the header.
beach.description_long:
Beach brings the warm feel of Thailand’s shores to your blog year round. But the Beach theme isn’t only just sand, sun, and sea. Beach features special post formatting for Aside, Gallery, Quote, and Status posts, along with a beautiful secondary menu area in the header.

Post Formats

You can bring some visual variety to your blog with the Beach theme’s five post formats.

  1. Standard: used for your standard blog posts.
  2. Aside: perfect for shorter posts that are only a few lines long and don’t need a large title on your home pages, archives, or search pages.
  3. Gallery: If you’re sharing a bunch of photos in a gallery, use this post format to show a special thumbnail with your post.
  4. Quote: Add a <blockquote> to a post using the Quote post format and your quote will receive a bolder style.
  5. Status: If you want to send out a short personalized update about what you’re currently up to, use a Status post.

Two Header Menus

If you create a short Custom Menu and assign it to the Secondary Menu area in Appearance → Menus Beach will create a beautiful vertical menu in your header.

Typekit Integration

If you want to dress up Beach even more you can easily enable the gorgeous Fertigo Pro using Typekit. You won’t need to edit CSS at all. Beach already contains all the styles it needs for Fertigo.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 530 except in the full-width layout where it’s 760.
  2. The sidebar width is 160

ever-after.name: Ever After
ever-after.author: Automattic
ever-after.description: A wedding blog-centric theme decorated with subtle but gorgeous textures and ornaments. The wide one-column layout is great for photos and videos of your wedding or your wedding plan that you want to share with family, friends, or the world.
ever-after.description_long:
Ever After is a wedding blog-centric theme decorated with subtle but gorgeous textures and ornaments. It’s designed with the idea of showing off your wedding photos and videos in mind. The wide one-column layout is great for that, therefore, even when your wedding is over, it’s the perfect theme to continue to share your gorgeous wedding memories with family, friends, or the world.

Are you still planning your wedding? No problem! Ever After can be used as a pre-wedding blog, and a wedding information site, with a RSVP form, Milestone countdown widget, and guestbook page template where a comment form appears at the bottom of the page allowing friends and family to post new entries.

Featured Post Slider

Featuring posts in a slider on your home page is easy. You just need sticky posts with Featured Images. Every sticky post you have (up to ten posts) that has a Featured Image (at least 850 pixels wide, 400pixels height) attached will show up in the scrolling marquee.

Ever After will also display your latest Quote or Status post in the footer on homepage. You can read more about how to do that on our Post Formats page.

Widget Areas

Ever After doesn’t have a sidebar, but don’t panic! Instead, there are four optional widget areas in the footer.

Custom Appearance

It’s your wedding and your wedding-blog. Customize Ever After with the custom background feature, a custom header image, and a custom menu.

Responsive Design

Ever After is designed to be responsive. It provides a tailored layout depending on the device you are using. This makes your blog look good not only on desktop browsers, but also on devices with smaller screens, such as the iPad and iPhone.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 870
  2. Suggested header size is 870 wide by 210 high.
  3. Large Featured Image for the slider is 850 wide by 400 high. To serve high-resolution images to HiDPI (Retina) display, 1700 wide by 800 high.

sight.name: Sight
sight.author: WPShower
sight.description: Sight blends simplicity with sophistication to bring refined beauty to your blog. It features a right sidebar for widgets, two custom menu locations, a slider for sticky posts, and a responsive layout that adapts to smaller screen sizes.
sight.description_long:
Sight blends simplicity with sophistication to bring refined beauty to your site. Elegant and versatile, Sight is a great choice for many different types of sites, including blogs and online magazines.

Featured Slider

Sight displays up to 30 of your latest sticky posts that have featured images in a prominent slider on the blog page. To add a post to the slider, mark it as sticky and give it a featured image.

Custom Menus

Sight comes with two custom menus, one in the header (Secondary Navigation) and the other just below the header area (Primary Navigation). The Secondary Navigation menu in the header only supports one menu level.

Featured Images

If you add a featured image to your non-sticky posts, Sight will display them alongside the post content on the home page and all archive pages.

Further Customization

Sight supports all of the WordPress features you love — a custom header, background, and widgets.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 640; sidebar width is 275. Sight’s layout is responsive, meaning the columns adjust to fit smaller screen sizes.
  2. Featured images in the sticky posts slider are 290 in height with a flexible width (maximum width is 640).
  3. All other featured images are 290 width, and 290 in height. These images are displayed on displayed on posts on the home page, on archive pages, and on the search results page.
  4. The suggested header image dimensions are 580 by 150 (width, height). However, the height is flexible so you can upload a smaller cropped image if you wish.

modern-news.name: Modern News
modern-news.author: StudioPress
modern-news.description: Modern News is a minimalistic theme that showcases your content in modern, easy-to-read fashion.
modern-news.description_long:
Got lots of news-style content and need a stylish frame? The Modern News theme is a great choice for sites that have a lot to say. Choose from many color schemes, and widgets that support everything from video to in-depth articles to great photography. Modern News is sleek, up-to-date, and always cutting-edge… just like your content.

The Modern News theme has multiple layouts and menus, breadcrumbs, and archive control. You can even add a customized Header image or custom background.

Theme Colors

The Modern News theme includes the following features: 7 color styles – blue, green, orange, pink, purple red and teal.

Featured Images

The Modern News theme is a great fit if you publish magazine or news style content. You can showcase multiple categories on the homepage and use featured images to make your site look stunning.

Layouts

You can choose from 6 different layout configurations for Modern News. You can have your content on the left with a sidebar on the right, flip that around, have two sidebars or even remove the sidebar altogether.

Plenty of Options

Part of Modern News’ charm is the option for customizing the look of your site. This includes sidebar widget area, two menu areas, and control over what content is displayed in your blog archive pages.

Custom Header Image and Background

You can further customize Modern News thanks to the Custom Header and Background options found in Appearance → Header and Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Content and One Sidebar: The main column width is 580 with one sidebar of 300 and an alternative sidebar of 150.
  2. Full-width layout: The main column is 910

Modern News theme documentation

blissful-blog.name: Blissful Blog
blissful-blog.author: Organic Themes
blissful-blog.description: The Blissful Blog is a beautifully designed wedding photography blog for couples, photographers and industry professionals.
blissful-blog.description_long:
Share your wedding day or your wedding portfolio with grace and style. The Blissful Blog is a beautifully designed wedding photography template for couples, photographers, and industry professionals.

Full-Width Featured Content Slider

Focus on your favorites with the graciously sized, full-width Featured Content Slider. To setup, add a featured post tag in Appearance → Customize → Featured Content, set a featured image on your favorite posts and tag them with the featured tag you chose.

Full-Width Page Template

Take advantage of the full-width of your pages, without a sidebar, by selecting the “Full Width” template under Page Attributes.

Widgets

Blissful Blog offers a sidebar template on single page, archive, and search views, and three footer widget areas on any page. You can assign widgets to each of these areas by going to Appearance -> Widgets.

Custom Header

Blissful Blog provides the ability to upload a Custom Header Image above (or in place of) your site’s title and description. The Custom Header can be set in Appearance -> Header.

Custom Menu

If you’d like to customize the centered navigation in your header, setup a custom menu by going to Appearance -> Menus.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 760 except in the two-column layout where it’s 495
  2. The primary sidebar width is 231
  3. The three footer sidebar widths are 231 each
  4. The Featured Content Slider images are a minimum of 920 wide by 640 tall

tuned-balloon.name: Tuned Balloon
tuned-balloon.author: Anariel Design
tuned-balloon.description: Tuned Balloon is an easy to use theme with responsive layout that looks great on any device, big or small. Tuned Balloon features different post formats, each displayed in their own unique way. If you want to make your blog post more flexible you can use different kinds of post formats such as image, gallery, video, aside, link or quotes.
tuned-balloon.description_long:
Tuned Balloon is a WordPress theme fine-tuned for musicians that offers features musicians or bands can`t live without, at least online.

Responsive Layout

The world is going mobile

The world is going mobile and be it a tablet, smart phone, laptop or a desktop this WordPress theme will adjust its size and present itself in the best light possible. No more zooming in or out, no more left/right scroll just a smooth browsing experience.

Features

Customization Options

Tuned Balloon Features: site title or logo, custom header and background.

Tuned Balloon makes it easy to create your dream site by changing theme’s fonts and colors. Change fonts, colors, or add your own CSS with the Custom Design upgrade.

Page Templates

Makes it easy to create your pages

Tuned Balloon offers widgetized home page template that makes it easy to add and create home page on your own. It contains top widgetized sidebar used for the main full screen image. Under the main image there are three columns widgetized sidebars that makes it easy to drag and drop whichever widget you want. This way you can create your dream home page. Bottom part of the theme is a full width widgetized footer.

This theme offers: home, bio and full-width template and full-width template without the header.

Post Formats

Style your blog

Tuned Balloon supports Post Formats and Sticky Posts. Style your website with aside, audio, gallery, image, link, quote and video post formats.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. “Tuned Ballon” is a theme with responsive layout.
  2. Home page image and custom header image should be at least 1920 in width .
  3. All images and video will scale to fit the viewing screen.

sidekick.name: Sidekick
sidekick.author: Automattic
sidekick.description: The single-column, widget-free child theme of Superhero.
sidekick.description_long:
Sidekick is a Superhero child theme without the bells and whistles. It’s a clean, widget-free, single-column theme that looks great with any content, but excels at displaying panoramic featured images.

Panoramic Featured Images

Sidekick will display a post’s featured image, full browser width, if its aspect ratio is at least 3×1 (width x height) and its minimum width is 1500px. You can set featured images on the Post Editor page under Featured Image.

Custom Menus

Sidekick has a single, primary custom menu area in the header, that can be set up by going to Appearance → Menus.

Custom Header and Background

Sidekick features a Custom Header that can be set under  Appearance → Header. The background can also be customized under Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 910
  2. Featured images must be at least 1500 wide and have an aspect ratio of 3x1 (width x height)

esquire.name: Esquire
esquire.author: Matthew Buchanan
esquire.description: An elegant and bold theme featuring multiple, visually distinct, Post Formats. Designed by Matthew Buchanan and inspired by the art direction of Esquire magazine.
esquire.description_long:
The elegant and bold Esquire theme lets you dress up your posts with multiple, visually distinct, Post Formats.

The Standard Format

The default, Standard Post Format adds a stylish drop cap to the first letter of your posts.

Aside and Gallery Formats

The Aside and Gallery Post Formats each hide the title of your post, letting your readers get straight to the content.

The Image Format

One of the most distinctive Post Formats in Esquire, Image Posts wrap the first image in your posts with a gold frame.

The Quote Format

Blockquotes in Quote Posts are wrapped in a bold red frame.

The Link Format

The first link in your Link Posts becomes the anchor for your post titles with a large bold link above each post.

The Video Format

If you have a video to post, the Video Format will wrap your content in a tv monitor frame.

The Audio Format

A 207×207 pixels Featured Image will add a fun LP jacket to your Audio Posts. You don’t have to use it for long players though. It’ll work for any Audio Post.

Note: You’ll need the Space Upgrade for your blog if you want to upload audio files.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width, and widget area width (located in your blog footer), is 560.

singl.name: Singl
singl.author: Automattic
singl.description: Singl is a minimalist theme that helps you to create a strong — yet beautiful — online presence. Primarily designed for music artists, Singl is a powerful and flexible theme.
singl.description_long:
Singl is a minimalist theme that helps you to create a strong — yet beautiful — online presence. Primarily designed for music artists, Singl is a powerful and flexible theme.

Optimal layout on different media devices

Singl is responsive — from desktop to mobile, and everything in between. The design will adapt to any screen without sacrificing usability or design integrity.

Front Page template

As the name suggests, this template is perfect for the front page, where you can introduce yourself to the world. One detail worth noting about Singl‘s Front Page template? It will also display child pages — so, it’s perfect if you want to have multiple sections.

When you first activate Singl, your posts will display in a traditional blog format. If you’d like to use this template as the front page of your site, just follow these instructions:

  1. Create or edit a page, and assign it to the Front Page template from the Page Attributes module.
  2. Go to Settings → Reading and set “Front page displays” to “A static page.”
  3. Select the page you just assigned as the “Front page,” and then choose another page as the “Posts page,” which will display your blog posts.

Custom menus, header, and background

Singl allows you to have a custom menu in the theme’s header. It can be set up by going to Appearance → Menus. Don’t forget to tick “Primary Menu” in the Menu Settings; if the option isn’t ticked, Singl won’t display any menu in its header.

Singl also lets you choose a custom header image. Simply go to Appearance → Header and set your new header.

And finally, you can easily apply a background color or image by going to Appearance → Background.

Theme options

Singl comes packed with multiple theme options available via the Customizer, including:

  • Full Page Background Image: set your background image to cover the whole page and stay fixed.
  • Subscribe Form: display a subscribe form in the theme’s footer.
  • Social Networks: add social links (Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, Google+, Instagram, YouTube, Vimeo, Vine, SoundCloud, Last.fm, Spotify, and iTunes) in the theme’s header to make it easy for your readers to stay connected with you.

Set up your site like Singl‘s demo

Want to replicate Singl‘s demo site? Here are the five steps:

1. Front Page and Blog

  1. Create or edit a page, and assign it to the Front Page template from the Page Attributes module.
  2. Go to Settings → Reading and set “Front page displays” to “A static page.”
  3. Select the page you just assigned as the “Front page,” and then choose another page as the “Posts page,” which will display your blog posts.

For the front page content, we used a SoundCloud shortcode. We also added a child page (“The Deep Web Tour”).

2. Custom menu

By default, Singl will not display any menu. To add one to your header, go to Appearance → Menus. Once your menu is created, tick “Primary Menu” in the Menu Settings.

3. Theme Options

Navigate to the Customizer, where you will find a Theme Options panel.

Tick “Full Page Background Image” and “Subscribe Form,” and then add your social network links.

4. Follow blog

Since we ticked the “Subscribe Form” theme option, we don’t need to display a follow button to logged-out users. Go to Settings → Reading and update your Follower Settings.

5. Sharing

On Singl‘s demo site, we also disabled the Sharing Buttons on pages so they don’t appear on the Front Page. To do the same, navigate to Settings → Sharing and update the “Show buttons on” setting.

Custom colors

Singl is designed to work seamlessly with Custom Colors and the Custom Design upgrade. Are the current colors not your style? We’ve included a few featured color palettes to inspire you, or you can choose your own.


Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 640.
  2. A widget area in the footer is 300

You can toggle the footer widget display on and off by clicking the widget trigger on the right side of the footer area:

blaskan.name: Blaskan
blaskan.author: Per Sandstrom
blaskan.description: Blaskan is a high quality, minimal theme focused on what WordPress does best, blogging. It sports a fully responsive layout that works well on all devices. Supports custom background, custom header, and featured image thumbnails in posts.
blaskan.description_long:
Blaskan is a minimal theme focused on blogging, designed to present your text, photos, and videos in a clean, contemporary interface. Your readers will love that its responsive layout means your content looks attractive—and readable—on devices of all sizes. Sporting crisp typography, three layout options, and post thumbnails—Blaskan is a perfect fit for a journal or photoblog.

Sidebars and Widgets

Blaskan has the option to create various layouts simply by assigning widgets to existing sidebar locations. A one-column layout means there are no widgets are assigned at all; a two-column layout is enabled if you add widgets to the main sidebar; and a three-column layout when you assign widgets to both the primary and secondary sidebars.

1-column Layout
2-column Layout
3-column Layout


A footer widget area is also available—especially useful in the one-column layout.

Custom Menus in Header and Footer

Blaskan comes with two Custom Menu locations: the main navigation area in the header, and a secondary menu in the footer. (Note: the footer menu only supports one level of menu depth.)

Example of footer menu in action.

And More…

  • Header and background—make it your own with a Custom Header Image and Custom Background.
  • Post thumbnails—this theme uses Featured Images for posts and pages to automatically show a thumbnail image. Images are displayed at full-width, see the Quick Specs below for exact dimensions.
  • Responsive design—Blaskan sports a flexible layout that works well in desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 830 in the 2-col layout, and 540 in the 1-col and 3-col layouts.
  2. Header image width is 1120 in the 2-col and 3-col layouts, and 540 in the 1-col layout. Header height is 160 in all 3 layouts.
  3. Post thumbnail widths are 830 in the 2-col, and 540 in the 1-col and 3-col layouts.

publish.name: Publish
publish.author: Konstantin Kovshenin
publish.description: Publish is a clean minimal theme which puts you and your content on stage. Ideal for single-author blogs.
publish.description_long:
If you’re a blogger, writer or poet, then Publish is the perfect choice. It’s a clean minimal theme, which puts you and your content on stage. Among other features, Publish has a responsive layout, supports custom background and a header image, several post formats, one sidebar and a custom menu.

Responsive Width

Its responsive design makes sure your work looks great on all screen sizes, ranging from large desktop screens, to small tablets and tiny mobile phones. On mobile phones, Publish will hide your navigation menu under a touch-activated drop-down menu, leaving less distraction, and more room for your content.

Custom Header or Logo

By default, Publish will display the site owner’s Gravatar in the top-left image area. You can easily modify that by uploading a custom header image in Appearance → Header, or you can remove it completely by selecting “Remove Header Image.”

Sidebar Widgets

Publish supports one sidebar, which is displayed just after the main navigation on the left hand site. You can configure this area by going to Appearance → Widgets. Please also note that on smaller screen sizes (tablets and mobile devices), the sidebar widgets will be pushed to the bottom of the page.

Custom Menu

The Primary Menu is located above the main sidebar, and can be configured by browsing to Appearance → Menus. The menu is one level deep, meaning it does not support sub-menus. On tablets and mobile devices, the menu is displayed at the top of the page.

Custom Background

You can define a custom color, or upload an image to use as your background in Appearance → Background from your Dashboard.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 525
  2. The main sidebar width is 180
  3. The suggested header image dimensions are 100 by 100 (width, height). However, the height is flexible so you can upload a bigger image if you wish.

liquorice.name: Liquorice
liquorice.author: Nudge Design
liquorice.description: Make your blog a little sweeter with Liquorice, a simple, clean vintage-style WordPress theme. Originally designed by NudgeDesign.ca, Liquorice features a right sidebar, custom background and header support, configurable RSS, Facebook and Twitter icons in the top left corner of the page, and special formatting for Aside, Gallery, Image and Quote posts.
liquorice.description_long:
Add a dash of color to your site with Liquorice, a wonderful new theme now available on WordPress.com.

Gorgeous textures and smooth-as-silk typography make this a striking backdrop for your content. This theme’s design is light and airy without being too plain or minimalistic; it’s a great fit for any type of site.

Liquorice features custom subscribe icons for RSS, Twitter, and Facebook for your site header and built-in support for the bold and adventurous Lobster typeface.

Custom Font: Lobster

If you choose to enable Lobster you’ll add an extra touch of retro feel to your site. Lobster’s bold, calligraphic strokes make it perfect for calling out titles and headings.

To enable the tailored Lobster font, first head over to Appearance → Custom Design → Switch to advanced (located on the right) and sign up for a Typekit account. After signup browse the Typekit site to find Lobster and add it to you « kit. » Note the Kit ID and enter the value back in your WordPress.com dashboard. That’s it—no need to manage selectors in the kit, this theme is ready to go.

Customizable

Make this theme your own with the custom background feature, a custom header image, and a custom menu. Head over to Appearance → Theme Options to add your social URLs to enable the Twitter and Facebook icons and links in the header.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 610 except in the full-width layout where it’s 788.
  2. The header image is 900 in width by 235 in height.
  3. The sidebar is 178 in width.

lifestyle.name: Lifestyle
lifestyle.author: StudioPress
lifestyle.description: Lifestyle is a colorful theme with a stylish frame for your all of your magazine or news related content.
lifestyle.description_long:
Got lots of magazine-style content and need a stylish frame? Lifestyle’s a great choice for sites that have a lot to say. Choose from ten content-friendly soft color schemes, and widgets that support everything from video to in-depth articles to great photography.

Thanks to the power of the Genesis Framework — multiple layouts and menus, breadcrumbs, and archive control. You can even add a customized Header image or custom background.

Featured Images

The Lifestyle theme is a great fit if you publish magazine or news style content. You can showcase multiple categories on the homepage and use featured images to make your site look stunning.

Layouts

You can choose from 6 different layout configurations for Lifestyle. You can have your content on the left with a sidebar on the right, flip that around, have two sidebars or even remove the sidebar altogether.

Plenty of Options

Part of Lifestyle’s charm is the option for customizing the look of your site. This includes sidebar widget area, two menu areas, and control over what content is displayed in your blog archive pages.

Custom Header Image and Background

You can further customize Lifestyle thanks to the Custom Header and Background options found in Appearance → Header and Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Content and One Sidebar: The main column width is 600 with one sidebar of 250.
  2. Full-width layout: The main column is 920

Lifestyle theme documentation

widely.name: Widely
widely.author: Themes Kingdom
widely.description: Widely is a minimalistic theme for businesses, creatives, and individuals to showcase their portfolios or just give their content a simple, well designed home.
widely.description_long:
Widely is a modern, elegant theme offering a flexible-width content area, Custom Background, Post Formats on both index and single view, as well as a bold display of your latest updates.

Featured Content slider

Special posts deserve a special place. With Widely, every post assigned with a certain tag and given a featured image will be displayed in the Featured Content Slider on the home page of your site. To enable the slider:

  1. Navigate to Appearance → Customize → Featured Content.
  2. Enter the name of a tag.
  3. Click the blue “Save” button at the bottom.

Once you’ve saved your changes, posts marked with this tag will appear in the featured content slider if they have a featured image. The suggested size for featured images is 960 pixels wide and 490 pixels high.

If you enable the featured content slider, it will be displayed instead of your custom header.

Widget Areas

Widely comes with four widget areas located in the footer of the site. The widget areas will activate once you drag widgets to them in Appearance → Widgets.

Featured Images

Widely supports Featured Images, which, if set, will appear above your content on the blog index and single view, bold and beautiful.

Custom Header

Widely supports a flexible-height custom header image, which can be configured under Appearance -> Header. If you enable the featured content slider, it will be displayed instead of your custom header.

Custom Background

Want to make Widely even more awesome? Replace the default background with your own custom background under Appearance → Background or in the Customizer.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 800.
  2. The featured image is 800 by 330 (width, height).
  3. Images in the featured content slider are 960 by 490 (width, height).
  4. Custom header images are 960 in width and flexible in height.

quintus.name: Quintus
quintus.author: Automattic
quintus.description: A theme that has an old-style appeal with semi-academic graciousness and elegant typography. Fitting for displaying either text or images, Quintus offers a fresh look with room for customization, including custom backgrounds, menus, header images, and the option to publish short aside posts.
quintus.description_long:
The Quintus theme offers an air of old-style appeal, semi-academic graciousness with elegant typography, while also offering an overall fresh look with room for customization and the latest WordPress features under the hood. It has a balanced mix of serif and sans-serif type. The theme is also flexible and responsive, which means it adapts to smaller screen sizes out of the box.

Quintus comes with support for some post formats, including asides for short posts, quote posts, and link posts. The Link format grabs the first link found in the content of your post and makes the title direct the visitor there.

It’s also appropriate for different uses. Whether you are creating a blog with plenty of pictures or a more text centric blog, Quintus should suit you with elegance. It goes without saying, but it also comes with much of the newer functionality you are accustomed to, including custom backgrounds, custom menus, header images, and the option to publish short aside posts, among others.

Widgets and Layout

Quintus has no visible theme options, but if you want complete focus on the content, you can create a one column layout if you remove all the widgets from the sidebar in Appearance → Widgets. Likewise, you can restore the two-column design by adding widgets back in.

Custom Header, Background, and Menus

These are all yours to customize however you see fit to craft your personal blog to hold your content.

Custom header and background on display.

Notice: if you add a header image but don’t explicitly set a header text color in Appearance → Header, then Quintus wraps the title and description with a black textured background. To remove said black background you need to explicitly set a color. (Tip: if you still want a white blog title you could enter a #fefefe color value.)

Another Color Scheme

The archaic color style

Quintus offers an additional color style named archaic you can choose from Appearance → Theme Options.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column max width is 640, with a responsive design.
  2. The header image is 1100 by 250 (width, height).
  3. The main column on the full-width template for pages is 940.

portfolio.name: Portfolio
portfolio.author: The Theme Foundry
portfolio.description: A minimal and clean portfolio theme, complete with featured slider and easy-to-configure portfolio pages. Designed to look great on large format displays, tablets and mobile devices.
portfolio.description_long:
By The Theme Foundry

Showcase your work.

It’s never been easier.

Portfolio makes it simple to show off your work to your clients, customers, and fans. Quickly create a new portfolio item and include images, videos, and text. Then, use the portfolio page interface to drag, drop, and organize your projects. You can even create multiple portfolio pages to showcase different types of work.

Add some style.

Make it your own.

Personalizing your new website should be fun. We’ve leveraged the built-in WordPress customizer, so adding your own background image or color is easy. On top of that, we’ve included seven hand selected font options. You can also set your own primary color for links and buttons with the built in color picker. Combine these fonts and colors with a custom background to match your brand and give your website a truly unique look.

Curate your home page.

Your best work front and center.

The home page introduces you and your work. First, feature your best projects or most important posts in the slider area at the top of the page. Simply check a box while creating a portfolio item and it automatically shows up in the slider. It’s also important for potential clients to see your latest work, so we’ve included three neatly organized thumbnails highlighting your most recent projects.

Help and additional information

If you need help with Portfolio be sure to read through the documentation by clicking the Support button at the top of the sidebar on this page. You can also ask us questions in the WordPress.com Portfolio support forum.

Looking to buy Portfolio for a self hosted WordPress.org website? The Theme Foundry builds WordPress templates for WordPress.org and you can purchase the Portfolio theme for WordPress.org directly from their website.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Portfolio is a flexible-width, responsive design.
  2. The main column maximum width is 550 with the sidebar.
  3. The main column maximum width is 860 without the sidebar.
  4. Slider and featured images are 860 by 450.
  5. Portfolio page and Homepage thumbnails are 242 by 135.
  6. All images and videos will scale to fit the viewing screen.

the-columnist.name: The Columnist
the-columnist.author: Ben Martineau
the-columnist.description: The Columnist blends big, bold Typography with a minimalist principals to produce a truly attractive design.
the-columnist.description_long:
The Columnist blends big, bold Typography with a minimalist principals to produce a truly attractive design.

Custom Menu

The Columnist provides a single navigation menu which displays at the top of your site. This menu will support any level of dropdowns and can be configured by visiting the Appearance → Menus admin screen. It’s important to note that this menu will only appear in templates that display multiple posts. This includes your homepage, search, and all archive views. The menu will be omitted in single posts and pages allowing your readers to focus on your content rather then where to go next.

Custom Header

Add a personal touch to The Columnist by uploading a custom header image and the black box that appears in the top-left corner will be replace with your image. Your header image will be displayed at 140 pixels wide by 180 pixels tall. Here you will see the default header shown on the left and custom image shown on the right:

Custom Background

Further customize your site by choosing a custom background color or uploading a background image. Here a preview of The Columnist with both a light-blue background color:

Featured Images

If you assign a feature image to one of your posts it will display differently depending on which template you are viewing. For instance: on the home page as well as all other pages that display multiple posts, your featured image will appear cropped at 180 pixels wide by 180 pixels tall. In cases where your original uploaded featured image is 610 pixles wide or wider, it will also appear at the very top of single posts and pages.

Widget Areas

Four widget areas are provided enabling you to add your own custom content directly below the content area in single posts and pages. Widgets will not appear in any template where multiple posts are displayed.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The sidebar width is 210.
  2. The main column width is 450.

arcade.name: Arcade
arcade.author: c.bavota
arcade.description: Arcade is a beautifully designed responsive theme which features a large header image on the home page. Stunning typography and multiple layout options make it easy to create a unique site that suits your every need.
arcade.description_long:
Arcade is a fully responsive theme that’s perfect for photographers, businesses, and bloggers. Grab your visitors’ attention right away with a large featured header image which resizes to fit the browser window — perfect for a product landing page! Use the widget area on the home page to feature your content with the unique Icon & Text widget.

From Desktops to Handheld Devices

Many people now access the internet from a mobile device, so why not make sure that your site will looks its best no matter what? Arcade is built using a responsive grid so that as the window size shrinks, elements will adjust accordingly. Whether it’s on an iPad, iPhone, Kindle Fire or Nexus tablet, your site will always look amazing.

Home Page Widgetized Area

One of the greatest features of Arcade is the widgetized home page top area.

This is where you can use the included Icon & Text widget to display any content that you want to appear right at the top of your site. Go to the Appearance → Widgets admin page to configure things.

Layout Options

Arcade gives you the option to select either one or two sidebars, and place them on the left, right or separated (meaning content in the middle). Every post and page even comes with a full-width option to remove the sidebars completely. Check out the Customizer to play with the layout options.

Improved Typography with Google Fonts

For a long time, websites had to use boring old web-safe fonts for all their text. Thanks to modern browsers and resources like Google Fonts, you can now rely on beautiful fonts to improve your website’s typography to make it easier on the eyes. Arcade uses Open Sans for all text, Raleway for all headers, and Megrim for the site name.

Post Block Page Template

Create an impressive looking block of posts on your home page instead of the default single post stream using the custom Post Block page template. Create a page and select the template from the dropdown list, then set your home page to display that page as your static front page.

Post Formats

Not all content is the same, that’s why Post Formats each have a unique look and feel. Check out the gallery below for some examples.

Link
Aside
Tiled gallery
Quote
Status update
Video

Social Menu

Making sure that your visitors know where else they can find you online is extremely important. Arcade comes with an easy-to-use social menu which allows you to include links to the most popular social sites. All you need to do is go to Appearance → Menus.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. Site width is 1200.
  2. Main content width is 750 with one sidebar or 550 with two sidebars.
  3. Layout options include 1, 2 or 3 columns.
  4. Max header image size is 1800 by 1200.

eventbrite-event.name: Eventbrite Single Event
eventbrite-event.author: Voce Platforms
eventbrite-event.description: Use this theme to showcase your one-time Eventbrite event and connect with your audience pre- and post-event with news updates, comments, and social sharing.
eventbrite-event.description_long:
We’ve teamed up with our partner Eventbrite to bring you this stylish yet understated theme. Eventbrite Single-Event is the go-to theme for any Eventbrite user who wants to build a modern and functional home to promote and showcase an event.

Event-specific Pages

It’s a no brainer that once you connect your Eventbrite account your event information will automatically be fed into this theme. But we’ve taken it one-step further — we have also included two built-in page templates that’ll make your site shine:

  • Event Info page: readers can learn all about the event here, including the date, location, and event description.
  • Attend Event page: a call to action! Users can register for the event directly from your page.

Sample Event Info page:

Sample Attend Event page:

You can find how to set these pages by going to your Theme Options page under Appearance >> Theme Options or visiting our theme support page.

Make it Your Own

We built this theme have ton of flexibility and customization options so you can build your own event brand or identity. You can upload custom header under Appearance >> Header, whether it’s a logo or an image.

This theme has a right sidebar for you to customize to your heart’s desire. Make sure to play around with the theme-specific widgets — an Eventbrite-styled free-from text widget (Eventbrite Introduction) to tell the readers a little bit about you:

and an Eventbrite Register/Ticket Button to encourage users to sign up — (used together with the Intro widget below):

Not to mention our cool Eventbrite Calendar widget that’s available to everyone:

Go to Appearance >> Widgets to check these out.

The Importance of Sharing

Social sharing is one of the most important and effective methods to get the word out about an event, to attract new attendees and most importantly to stay connected with your audience. This theme comes loaded with all the bells and whistles of making sharing easy — whether it’s adding a share button, or adding a twitter timeline, or just a simple follow blog widget — we’ve gotten you covered.

For more information about how to set up the best site with this theme, please visit our theme support page.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 705
  2. The sidebar width is 320

imbalance2.name: Imbalance 2
imbalance2.author: WPShower
imbalance2.description: A theme designed in strict modern style with a minimalistic touch. Imbalance 2 can easily turns your blog to an attractive blog, a portfolio or even an online magazine. It supports both fixed and fluid layouts. Also it allows you to choose a theme color.
imbalance2.description_long:
Imbalance 2 is designed in a strict modern style with a minimalistic touch. This theme can easily turn your site into an attractive blog, a portfolio, or even an online magazine.

Layout options

Imbalance 2 offers two layout options, fluid and fixed.

Fixed width
Fluid width

Theme Options

Custom Theme Color

With the Imbalance 2 theme you can set your own blog accent color from Appearance → Theme Options, which is used in links and several other places throughout the theme.

Featured Posts

The theme optionally allows you to promote sticky posts as featured posts and display them below a post in single view.

Featured Images

To display an image for each post on your blog home page, you’ll need to set a featured image for each post, choosing an image at least 210 pixels wide. (Note that it doesn’t necessarily need to be inserted into the post.)

Widgets

Imbalance 2 supports three widget areas, one in the header and two in the footer.

Custom Appearance

You can even customize Imbalance 2 with the Custom Background feature, a Custom Header Image, Custom Menus, and a full-width template.

The screenshot below shows the column usage in the header. Please refer to this to see how to customize it.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 710 except in the full-width layout, where it’s 960.
  2. Widget width is 210.
  3. The custom header image is 210 by 170 (width, height).
  4. The featured image works best with images at least 210 wide.

writr.name: Writr
writr.author: Automattic
writr.description: Writr is a minimalist, content-oriented tumblelog theme perfect for your personal blog. It comes packed with 6 different color schemes: turquoise (default), blue, green, grey, purple, and red. With a modern look and attention to crisp typography, Writr put the focus on your content.
writr.description_long:
Writr is a minimalist, content-oriented tumblelog theme perfect for your personal blog.

Optimal layout on different media devices

Writr is responsive — from desktop to mobile, and everything in between. The design will adapt to any screen without sacrificing usability or design integrity.

Post Formats

Writr supports all post formats. Each post format has a unique icon.

Custom Header and Gravatar

By default, Writr will display the site owner’s Gravatar in the header.

If you want to display something other than your Gravatar, you can upload a Custom Header Image in Appearance → Header, or you can remove it completely by selecting Remove Header Image.

Custom Background

With Writr, you can easily apply a background color or image by going to Appearance → Background. If you want your background image to cover the whole page and stay fixed, go to Customizer → Theme Options and tick “Full Page Background Image.”

Connect

Writr allows you to add links to your Twitter, Facebook, Google+, LinkedIn, and Tumblr accounts in the theme’s footer. First, connect these services to Publicize, by going to Settings → Sharing. Once connected, navigate to the Customizer, where you’ll find a new Connect panel. Select the account(s) you want to link to, and their respective icons will be displayed:

Custom Menu

Writr has a primary custom menu area that can be set up by going to Appearance → Menus. It will display three levels of menu items.

Multiple color schemes

Writr comes packed with 6 different color schemes: Turquoise (default), Blue, Green, Grey, Purple, and Red. Navigate to the Customizer and click on the Colors panel to select the one you like.

If you want to choose your own colors, Writr will work seamlessly with Custom Colors, which is part of the Custom Design upgrade.

Wider content area

Are you finding Writr‘s content area too narrow? Go to the Customizer and tick the “Wider Content Area” checkbox.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 460 unless you have selected the “Wider Content Area” theme option, where it is 720
  2. The sidebar width is 220.

sorbet.name: Sorbet
sorbet.author: WordPress.com
sorbet.description: Sorbet is a delicious treat for your blog or website. Colorful post formats help your content pop, while secondary information (navigation, search, social links, and widgets) is tucked neatly away in the header for easy access that doesn’t crowd your content.
sorbet.description_long:
Sorbet is a colorful, mouth-watering treat for your personal blog or website. The mobile-friendly design looks great on any device, while post formats highlight your best content. If you’re seeking a fun new look for your site, we think you’ll enjoy a taste of Sorbet.

Post Formats & Sticky Posts

Post Formats and Sticky Posts are denoted with different colors and icons above the post content. Combine formatted content with standard posts to give your blog a fresh, varied look.

Quote
Aside
Video
Image
Sticky

Featured Images

Featured Images are displayed above the post content on the blog index and archive pages at 700 pixels wide.

Image-formatted posts display the featured image on single post view as well.

Widgets

Sorbet includes four optional widget areas: a Sidebar alongside your content, and three Header Columns located behind a gear icon in the header.

Sorbet without active Primary Sidebar

If you haven’t added widgets to the Sidebar, Sorbet becomes a sleek one-column theme, making its tumblelog-style design perfect for cataloguing your web finds.

Configure these areas by going to Appearance → Widgets.

Social Links

You can add links to a multitude of social services to a toggle menu (the heart icon) by following these steps:

  1. Create a new Custom Menu, and assign it to the Social Links Menu location
  2. Add links to each of your social services using the Links panel
  3. Icons for your social links will automatically appear under the heart icon in the header

Custom Menus

Sorbet includes three Custom Menus. The main navigation is located behind a toggle menu icon in the header (look for the three horizontal lines):

There is also an optional single-level menu in the footer:

Custom Header & Background

You can personalize your site with a custom header under Appearance → Header:

The background can also be customized by going to Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 646.
  2. The Primary sidebar width is 250.
  3. The Header Column widget widths are 300.

picks.name: Staff Picks
picks.description: Determines which themes are shown in the "Choose a theme" step during signup.

newsworthy.name: Newsworthy
newsworthy.author: WPThemes NZ
newsworthy.description: Newsworthy theme is a simple theme with cool design and beautiful color accents. It’s a fun and functional theme perfect for the personal blogger.
newsworthy.description_long:
Newsworthy is a brightly-hued theme designed for news, magazine, and personal blogs. Its striking colors are sure to grab your readers’ attention at first glance! Newsworthy supports multiple authors, post formats, widgets, custom colors, and header.

Widgets

You can configure your sidebar by going to Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Header and Background

With Newsworthy, you can easily add your own custom logo by following these simple instructions: Appearance → Header.

Adding a background pattern is just as easy: Appearance → Background.

Full Width Page Template

Newsworthy includes a full-width page template if you want to keep the sidebar on your blog but remove it on a page. You can use the Full Width Page Template, by selecting it under Page Attributes.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 585 except in the full-width layout where it’s 825.

skylark.name: Skylark
skylark.author: Blank Themes
skylark.description: Skylark is a bright, clean, and responsive theme that’s a great starting point for individuals and businesses who want to establish a professional online presence. Not only is the theme well-suited for general blogging, but its showcase and portfolio page templates make it easy to highlight latest news and projects in style.
skylark.description_long:
Skylark is a bright, clean, and responsive theme that’s a great starting point for individuals and businesses who want to establish a professional online presence. Not only is it well-suited for general blogging, but its showcase and portfolio page templates make it easy to highlight latest news and projects in style.

Showcase page template

Upon activation, Skylark displays your posts in a traditional blog format on the front page, but if you’d like to highlight your content professionally, then you can use the Showcase page template.

To use the Showcase page template, create or edit a page, and select “Showcase Template” from the Page Attributes module. If you’d like use the Showcase page template on your front page (like the Skylark demo site), go to Settings → Reading, and set the Front page option to Static Page. Select the page you just assigned the Showcase page template to as your front page and then choose another page to serve as your blog page.

The Showcase page template contains several special features: a featured slider for sticky posts, a customizable introductory message, and featured categories. Read on to learn more.

Featured slider


The Showcase page template offers a featured slider for sticky posts. If you’d like a post to appear in the slider, mark it as sticky and assign it a featured image that’s at least 500 pixels wide.

Introductory message


Why not introduce yourself and your work to your visitors? The introductory message appears just below the slider. Customize the message by going to Appearance → Theme Options.

Featured categories


As the final element on the Showcase page template, featured categories appear below the introduction, arranged in alphabetical order by category name. Skylark displays the four latest posts from each featured category. Choose a primary featured category in Appearance → Theme Options. To feature additional categories, go to Posts → Categories and assign your primary category as the “Category parent” of each additional category you wish to feature.

Post formats and Portfolio page template

Want to create a post with just an image? How about a gallery, or a video? The WordPress post formats feature is perfect for those cases. When you create a post with the image, gallery, or video post format, Skylark will display it as full-width on the single view, allowing more room for your content to shine. Furthermore, you can view up to 24 of your image, gallery, and video posts in a simple grid layout on the Portfolio page template.

To activate the Portfolio page template, refer to the instructions given above for using the Showcase page template. The only difference is that you’ll select the “Portfolio Template” from the the page attributes module.

To add a post to the Portfolio page template, create or edit a post with the image, video, or gallery post format, and assign it featured image that’s at least 280 pixels wide.

Responsive Layout

Skylark’s responsive layout ensures that your content looks great not only on desktop browsers but also on devices with smaller screens.

Customize further

Skylark supports all of the WordPress features you love — a custom menu, custom background, custom header, and a right sidebar for widgets.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 670 except in the full-width layout where it’s 920.
  2. Primary sidebar width is 231.
  3. The header image size is max 920 wide.

bonpress.name: BonPress
bonpress.author: WPZOOM
bonpress.description: BonPress is the perfect personal blog theme. Packed with Post Formats and subtle details, it offers a unique blogging experience.
bonpress.description_long:
If you’re a writer or blogger, then BonPress is the theme for you. It is a simple and traditional theme, that puts your content in the center of attention. Among other features, BonPress has a custom menu, a responsive layout, supports several post formats, custom backgrounds and has a left-hand sidebar.

Sidebar Widgets

BonPress supports one sidebar, which is displayed just after the main navigation on the left hand site. You can configure this area by going to Appearance → Widgets. Please also note that on smaller screen sizes (tablets and mobile devices), the sidebar widgets will be pushed to the bottom of the page.

Custom Menu

The Primary Menu is located above the main sidebar, and can be configured by browsing to Appearance → Menus. On tablets and mobile devices, the menu is displayed at the top of the page.

Post Formats

Want to add visual interest to a post on the front and archive pages? Assign it to one of five post formats — Aside, Image, Video, Quote, and Link — and BonPress will display a neat post-format-specific icon next to the post’s title.

Custom Background

You can define a custom color, or upload an image to use as your background in Appearance → Background from your Dashboard.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 614.
  2. The slider sidebar content width is 206.

ideation-and-intent.name: Ideation and Intent
ideation-and-intent.author: Automattic
ideation-and-intent.description: They say a picture is worth a thousand words and this theme was built for photoblogging! Showcase your images in style with front-page featured images and an automatically generated photo sidebar.
ideation-and-intent.description_long:
Ideation & Intent features beautiful typography, bright colors and clean lines. Your photos will get the royal treatment in the featured post area and custom image sidebar.

Homepage Display

The home page will display a list of your recent posts in reverse chronological order. The latest post uses a special template which displays the title, a large featured image, excerpt, and, the author’s Gravatar. The minimum recommended width and height for the large image is 520 px wide by 345 px high. If there are any images attached to this post they will be displayed in a neat little grid just below the excerpt. An example of the featured template can be seen below.

Featured Post Template

Each subsequent post uses a very minimal template that displays a small version of the featured image (96 px by 47 px), the post’s title, and meta information about the post. If no featured image is set for a post, the first attached image will be used in it’s place.

Minimal Post Template

Sidebars

A custom Images sidebar has been built into Ideation & Intent. This sidebar will display images from the latest 9 posts that have image attachments. Up to 8 images will be displayed for each post and each image links directly to the post it is attached to.

A second sidebar is available to use, but only if you choose to do so. You can customize its display by adding any number of widgets via Appearance → Widgets. Please note that this sidebar will only display if it has been populated with widgets. It will also be hidden when viewing single posts and pages.

Image sidebar shown on the left and widget sidebar shown on the right.

Custom Menu

Ideation & Intent provides a single navigation menu which displays at the top of your site. In the screenshot below, you will see that the menu is on the same line as the site title. If there is room, this is exactly where the menu will display. However, if the width of the menu and the width of the sidebar are larger than the width of the template, the navigation will display below the site title.

Menu shown on the right with only three links.

If you would like to ensure that the menu always displays along-side the site title, we suggest that you use a custom menu with just a few links on the top level. You can then add more links to sub-menus and Ideation & Intent will create dropdowns for you. Read more about custom menus.

Custom Header

Add some personal flair to this theme by uploading a custom header image. For best results, please upload an image that is at least 1124 pixels wide. Images can be of any height. Once your custom image is uploaded, you will be able to crop it to any height that you like. Read more about header images.

Custom Background

Customize your site by choosing a custom background color or uploading a background image. A transparent, textured image comes installed which enables you to choose a color that will inherit the subtle texture. If no texture is desired, click the “Remove Background Image” and your background color will display smoothly. Read more about custom backgrounds

Default
Orange
Blue

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 525 except in single posts and pages where it’s 812
  2. Each sidebar is 227 wide
  3. Suggested header size is 1124  by 200
  4. The minimum recommended size for the featured image on the blog page is 520 by 345
  5. Small featured images on the blog page are 96 by 47

nishita.name: Nishita
nishita.author: Brajeshwar
nishita.description: A simple, elegantly styled photoblog theme. Includes dark or light color schemes, wide or narrow layout choice, three footer widgets areas, and an optional sidebar.
nishita.description_long:
Nishita is a simple, minimally-styled photoblogging theme with a choice of dark or light color scheme—the muted design puts all the focus on your photos. Not only is this theme designed for photos, it loves big photos: the default layout is super-wide at 1024 pixels.

Theme Options

Theme options include two layout choices: “Photoblog” at 1024 pixels wide, or “Blog” at 768 pixels wide. The same form also allows choosing the dark or light color scheme.

Reduced Photoblog Look

For a reduced photoblog look, where you showcase one photo at a time, you could change your WordPress.com reading settings to show one post per page, and thus only one image will show on your front page. Your site visitors would then navigate to older photos by using the navigation links below.

Thumbnail Archives

This photo-loving theme also uses post thumbnails to show a small version of images on your archive pages. Out of the box, the theme will crop the image attached to the post and make a thumbnail for you. If you prefer to crop your own thumbnail—or use a different image—use the Featured Image tool to set the alternate thumbnail image.

Widgets and Sidebar

Love widgets? Use the three footer widget areas to keep your photos full-width and the sidebar hidden. You can also add widgets to the “Primary Sidebar” to make a sidebar appear next to the main column—otherwise the sidebar will remain hidden on all pages.

Custom Appearance

Customize Nishita even more with the custom background feature, a custom header image, and a custom menu.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 1024 for the Photoblog layout, and 768 for the Blog layout.
  2. Header image size is 1024 by 295 (width, height).

minimalizine.name: Minimalizine
minimalizine.author: Rizqy Hidayat
minimalizine.description: A simple and clean theme, perfect for focusing on your content. It supports 3 widget areas above the footer.
minimalizine.description_long:
Minimalizine is an elegantly simple solution for your blog or website, that puts the focus on your content. With clean lines and a sleek modern look, this theme supports featured images, multiple post formats, three footer widget areas, and a custom menu in the header.

Widgets

You can configure up to three footer widget areas by going to Appearance -> Widgets.

Custom Menu

This theme includes one drop-down navigation menu in the header. By default it will display your Pages, but you can also assign a custom menu to the Primary Menu area under Appearance -> Menus.

Custom Header and Background

Minimalizine allows you to set a custom header, with flexible-width or -height, under Appearance -> Header. You can also customize the theme with a background color or image by going to Appearance -> Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 520
  2. Each footer sidebar is 220

grisaille.name: Grisaille
grisaille.author: Nudge design
grisaille.description: A classic two-column design adjusted for mobile browsing. Both featured images and Sticky posts are supported. Twitter, Facebook, and Google Plus Theme Options available, as well as custom menus, header image, and background. It’s pronounced “griz-eye”.
grisaille.description_long:
Grisaille (pronounced “griz-eye”) is a modern, grungy theme offering a flexible-width custom header, custom background, as well as convenient and stylish buttons to link to your Twitter, Facebook, and Google+ accounts.

Post Excerpts

Grisaille displays Post Excerpts on the blog index. If you don’t feel like crafting an excerpt, the theme will automatically use the post’s first 20 words.

Social Networking Icons

Navigating to Appearance -> Theme Options allows you to put in links to your Facebook, Twitter, and/or Google+ accounts, and their respective icons will be placed prominently in the header of your blog.

Featured Images
