Grisaille supports Featured Images, which, if set, will appear on the blog index next to your content. If you’ve set a Featured Image for a Sticky post, it will take up the full width of the content column at 590 pixels wide.

Widgets

Grisaille includes one widget area, the Primary Sidebar, which displays a search field, bookmarks, archives, categories, and meta by default if no widgets are configured in Appearance -> Widgets.

Custom Background and Header

Want to make Grisaille even more awesome? Replace the default background with your own custom background or a flexible-width custom header. The custom header will display when configured in Appearance -> Header.

Custom Menu

Grisaille supports one custom menu in the header. The theme will fall back to display your pages if the Primary Navigation menu is not configured and saved. You also have the option of adding a menu to the sidebar using a Custom Menu widget.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 605
  2. The post thumbnails are 250 wide except for Sticky posts where they’re 590 wide
  3. The sidebar width is 260

balloons.name: Balloons
balloons.author: Moargh.de
balloons.description: Balloons is a simple, whimsical, responsive theme with a parallax scrolling effect and three footer widget areas.
balloons.description_long:
Balloons is a charming, playful theme, perfect for a tumblog-style blog. This one-column design features parallax scrolling balloons in the header, creating a unique sense of depth. The theme also includes support for custom headers, backgrounds, a custom menu, and three widget columns in the footer.

Custom Header and Backgrounds

You can add your own custom background under Appearance -> Backgrounds, or a flexible-height custom header under Appearance -> Header.

Custom Menu

Balloons supports one custom menu in the header area and can be configured in Appearance → Menus.

Widgets

This theme supports three optional widget areas in the footer that can be configured in Appearance → Widgets.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 640
  2. The footer sidebar column widths are 200

my-life.name: My Life
my-life.author: Justin Tadlock
my-life.description: A serene blogging theme that emphasizes your content with readable typography. It uses post formats, has three nav menu locations, and supports one-, two-, or three-column layouts.
my-life.description_long:
My Life is a serene, textured blogging theme with up to three columns for your content. With multiple custom menus, sidebar arrangements, and support for post formats, it’s a flexible and versatile home for your personal journal or blog.

Widgets

You can configure up to two sidebar widget areas by going to Appearance -> Widgets.

Theme Options

You can change the placement of each widget area such that they appear to the left or right of the content column, or, if two sidebars are active, on each side of the content column. You’ll find these settings by going to Customizer -> Theme Options.

Custom Menu

This theme includes three navigation menus — two in the header and one in the footer. You can assign a custom menu to any or all of these areas by going to Appearance -> Menus.

Header Top


The Header Top menu is located across the top of your site, and supports up to four levels of sub-menus. This menu will display your Pages by default if no menu is assigned.

Header Bottom


The Header Bottom menu is located to the right of or underneath the site title (depending on the site title and description length) in the header, and supports up to four levels of sub-menus. This menu will only display if configured in Appearance -> Menus.

Footer


The Footer menu is located at the very bottom of your site and supports one level of menu items. This menu will only display if configured in Appearance -> Menus.

Custom Header and Background

My Life allows you to set a flexible-width or -height custom header under Appearance -> Header. You can also customize the theme with a background color or image by going to Appearance -> Background.

Full-Width Page Template

My Life comes with a full-width page template that removes the sidebar(s) should you need more room for your content; it can be activated by editing the page in question and setting the Page Template to Full Width, No Sidebars. (Please note, if you do not have any active sidebars, the full-width page template will look the same as the regular page layout.)

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. With no sidebars active, the main column width is 808
  2. With one sidebar active, the main column width is 599 except in the full-width layout where it’s 908
  3. With two sidebars active, the main column width is 469 except in the full-width layout where it’s 908
  4. With one sidebar active, the sidebar width is 251
  5. With two sidebars active, the sidebar width is 170

hero.name: Hero
hero.author: Manishg
hero.description: A very neat and clean, black and red business theme. The theme supports sidebar and footer widgets, and simple and neat typography. It also has a front page template with featured post slider and promotional callout areas.
hero.description_long:
Feature the content that matters the most to you and your readers with Hero’s dark, minimal design, and Front Page template.

Front Page Template

Hero’s Front Page template is designed to be the home page of your site, sending readers to the information you think is most important.

To get started, create a new page and assign it the Front Page template under Page Attributes. Then set that page to be your Static Front Page.

Featured Content Slider: Add a tag under Appearance → Customize → Featured Content. Use this tag on posts with a featured image, and they’ll show up in the slider.

Tagline Area: Under ‘Home Promos’ in the Customizer, set a Tagline and select a page from the dropdown list for the Tagline link.

Promotional Callouts: Under ‘Home Promos’ in the Customizer, choose a tag name from the dropdowns for the promo areas. Tag posts with these tags to have them show up in the three callout areas.

Full-Width Page Template

If you would like to remove the sidebar from a page for a cleaner, full-width look, assign your page the Full Width template under Page Attributes.

Widgets

Hero includes a primary sidebar widget area and four footer widget areas that can be customized in Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Menu

Set up a custom navigation menu that will appear in the header’s custom menu area by going to Appearance → Menus.

Custom Header and Background

Hero features a fully flexible Custom Header that can be set under  Appearance → Header. The background can also be customized under Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 620 except in the full-width layout where it’s 940
  2. The homepage featured post slider has the suggested image dimensions of 960 wide and 350 tall
  3. The homepage callout areas have a suggested image size of 295 wide and 155 tall
  4. The sidebar widget area is 278 wide
  5. Each footer widget area is 170 wide

flounder.name: Flounder
flounder.author: Kelly Dwan & Mel Choyce
flounder.description: Flounder is a flat, minimally styled theme for bloggers which features colorful support for post formats and a clean, responsive layout.
flounder.description_long:
Flounder is a flat-design, minimally styled theme for bloggers which features colorful support for post formats and a clean, responsive layout.

Post Formats

This theme supports Aside, Image, Video, Link, Quote, Gallery, and Status Post Formats. Each post type has a unique icon and color:

Aside
Image
Gallery
Link
Quote
Status

Widgets

Use the sidebar in Flounder to display additional information about yourself and your blog by adding some widgets under Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Menu

Flounder includes one menu area next to the content, which can be set up by going to Appearance → Menus. The menu works a bit differently than other themes: menu items with a submenu have an arrow below them, followed by the submenu items, instead of a drop-down or slide-out submenu.

Custom Header and Background

Personalize your site with a custom header under Appearance → Header. Your header image will be displayed within a circle 220 pixels in diameter. If you choose to display your site title, it will appear on top of this image.

You can also customize the background by going to Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 440.
  2. The sidebar width is 180.
  3. The header is 220 square.
  4. At screen widths under 1280 any widgets in the right sidebar move into the left sidebar area, and the theme adopts a two-column layout.

brand-new-day.name: Brand New Day
brand-new-day.author: Caroline Moore
brand-new-day.description: A fun illustrated theme in four “flavors,” perfect for personal websites or blogs.
brand-new-day.description_long:
Brand New Day is a charmingly illustrated theme that comes in four different “flavors”–day, night, autumn and winter–plus different sidebar arrangements and a narrow/wide column option. The fun, whimsical style lends itself well to personal websites and blogs.

Theme Options

A quick visit to Appearance → Theme Options from your WordPress.com dashboard lets you pick from the four different “flavors.” You’re only two clicks (make a choice, click save) from customizing the appearance of your blog.



But that’s not all you can change. You can choose what side of your blog the sidebar appears on — or even remove it altogether — and even remove the default search form from the header of your blog (you might want to use a widget instead.)

The neatest customization choice might be the Simple Blog Mode. With one click you can remove the search bar from the header, drop the sidebar, and narrow the content column. It simplifies the look of your blog and makes your content the focus. It’s great for blogs where you’re continually publishing new posts.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 630 except in the full-width layout where it’s 1000.
  2. The sidebar width is 210.

delicacy.name: Delicacy
delicacy.author: Aleksandra Łączek
delicacy.description_long:
Delicacy is a stylish theme designed for food bloggers.

Featured Content Section

Give special attention to select posts by adding them to the featured content section.

The featured content section will display on your site’s front page directly above the post content.

To enable this section:

  1. Navigate to Appearance → Customize → Featured Content.
  2. Enter the name of a tag.
  3. Click the blue “Save” button at the bottom.

Once a tag name has been saved, posts having this tag will appear in the featured content section. You can specify an image to be displayed with each post by setting a featured image. The suggested size for featured images is 588 pixels wide and 289 pixels high.

Delicacy’s featured content area.

Custom Header

Add some personal flair to your site by uploading a custom header image. For best results, please upload an image that is at least 980 pixels wide. Images can be of any height. Once your custom image is uploaded, you will be able to crop it to any height that you like. Read more about header images.

Delicacy’s custom header image.

Custom Background

Customize your site by choosing a custom background color or uploading a background image. Read more about custom backgrounds.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 600
  2. The sidebar width is 279
  3. The suggested featured image size is 588 wide and 289 high.
  4. The suggested custom header size is 980 wide and 250 high.

yumblog.name: Yumblog
yumblog.author: UpThemes
yumblog.description: Yumblog is a delicious blog theme that can be used for a variety of purposes, including food blogs, recipe sharing, and web journaling.
yumblog.description_long:
by UpThemes

Do you love sharing recipes? Yumblog is a simple theme for food bloggers to publish recipes, meals and tips easily.

View Recipes Anywhere on Any Device

We’ve gone to great lengths to ensure your recipes can be easily viewed and printed on any medium. Simple load in your content and Yumblog handles the rest!

Supports Jetpack Recipe Shortcode

Embed recipes into your posts and make them look amazing with a handwritten recipe design. Instructions for embedding recipes can be found here.

Supports Jetpack Infinite Scroll

Visitors can endlessly scroll through your blog posts, causing their mouths to water in search of the perfect recipe.

Author Archive Styles

We’ve made sure to add styling for author archives within Yumblog, making it easy for you to link to recipes added by any contributor who has published a post.

Multiple Color Schemes, Endless Possibilities

With the ability to select from a few free color schemes along with an unlimited set of color combinations with WordPress.com Custom Colors add-on, Yumblog makes it easy to customize your blog’s appearance.

Social Icon Menu

Add your social links to the header by enabling the Social Menu that we’ve added to this theme. Then simply add links to your online profiles and you’re all set!

Featured Content Front Page Slider

Yumblog adds support for featured posts and recipes with Jetpack. Simply use the Theme Customizer to define a tag to be used for featured posts and off you go!

confit.name: Confit
confit.author: Automattic
confit.description: Confit is the perfect theme for restaurants and cafés. With Confit, it’s easier than ever to add (and edit) your menu, and to show off your best dishes and restaurant decoration. Map your location so customers can easily find you, and display phone numbers and business hours with our specialized Contact Info widget.
confit.description_long:
Building a website for your restaurant or café? Confit is the perfect theme for you. With Confit, it’s easier than ever to add (and edit) your menu, and to show off your best dishes and restaurant decoration. Map your location so customers can easily find you, and display phone numbers and business hours with our specialized Contact Info widget. You can even connect with Open Table, allowing your customers to make reservations directly from your website.

Hours & Location

Confit makes the most of the Contact Info widget, which allows you to place the information your customers need most — maps, phone numbers, and opening hours — right into the sidebar.

Reservations

Using OpenTable? Grab your HTML code from OpenTable and add it to your sidebar using the OpenTable widget.

Simple Food Menus

Add your delicious food menus all at once, or edit them on the fly by going to Food Menus in your Dashboard. Reorder the food menu items at any time. Changing the order of items in the menu is as easy as dragging and dropping them up and down.

After you’ve added food menu items, simply create a new page with the Menu page template.

Voila! You now have beautiful food menus. If you’ve added featured images to your food items, they’ll appear in your menu. Want to offer a downloadable copy of your menu? No problem. Upload a PDF version from Theme Option in the Customizer, and the menu page will display a download button on the top right of the menu page’s title spot (see screenshot below).


– Confit Menu Page Template

Full page background image

Showcase your restaurant’s food and interior with a full-page background. The maximum width for a full-page background is 1600px. To add a global background image that will appear on every page, go to Appearance -> Background. If you want a page to have its own background image, just add a featured image to that page.
Note: Confit allows you to add background image that covers the whole page with a fixed position. If you want to deactivate this functionality, go to Customizer -> Theme Options and tick “Disable Full Page Background Image”.

Custom Header

Confit supports a flexible header image, which is perfect for a logo or other small image. Add yours to personalize your Confit from Appearance -> Header.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 558
  2. The sidebar width is 222
  3. The maximum width for a full-page background is 1600 wide
  4. The featured image for blog posts works best with images at least 618 wide
  5. The featured image for food menu items works best with images at least 138 wide, 104 height.

fontfolio.name: Fontfolio
fontfolio.author: Marios Lublinski
fontfolio.description: A stylish, clean, responsive portfolio theme, perfect for typographers, illustrators, or graphic designers.
fontfolio.description_long:
Fontfolio is a grid-style theme, perfect for designers, illustrators, and artists. Show off your best work with Featured Images, a clean, responsive layout, two custom menu areas, support for multiple post formats, a search field in the header, and optional social network icons.

Featured Images

To get the most from Fontfolio‘s grid-based design on the blog index and archives pages, you can assign Featured Images to your posts. If no Featured Image is present, the theme will pull the post’s first attached image instead. If no images are attached to the post, the theme will pull the first image from the content of your post.

The first post on your home page will always display larger than the surrounding posts, at 562 x 461 pixels, cropped. The rest of the posts display at 282 x 211 pixels, cropped. (The theme will size the images for you automatically, so you don’t need to crop them yourself, unless you want a very specific crop.)

Social Links

Social Links

You can add links to your Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Tumblr accounts to your site’s header. First, connect these services to Publicize, by going to Settings → Sharing. Once connected, navigate to the Customizer, where you’ll find a new Connect panel. Select the account(s) you want to link to, and their respective icons will appear in the header.

Post Formats

Fontfolio supports Aside, Image, Video, Link, Quote, and Gallery post formats. Formatted posts appear on blog and archive pages with a post-format-specific symbol on hover, like so:

Image Post Format

Widgets

Fontfolio includes one sidebar on single posts, pages, and search results; this can be configured under Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Menu

This theme supports two custom menu areas:

The Primary Menu, located at the very top of the site, alongside the search bar. If no menu is assigned, this area will display your Pages by default.

The Secondary Menu, next to the site title and description. If no menu is assigned, nothing will display in this area.

You can assign menus to these areas under Appearance → Menus.

Custom Header and Background

Personalize Fontfolio with a flexible-width or -height custom header under Appearance → Header. Your selected image will appear just above the site title and description; this is the perfect space for your logo.

You can also apply a background color or image by going to Appearance → Background.

Full-Width Page Template

If you want to keep the sidebar on your blog but remove it on a page, you can use the Full Width, No Sidebar template, set under Page Attributes.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 788 except in the full-width layout where it’s 1125.
  2. The sidebar width is 278.
  3. The latest post’s featured image on the blog page is 562 x 461, cropped.
  4. Any subsequent post’s featured image on the blog and archive pages is 282 x 211, cropped.

rusty-grunge.name: Rusty Grunge
rusty-grunge.author: Christopher Wallace
rusty-grunge.description: A somewhat dirty, grungy theme with two widget areas and several customization options, including Custom Background, Header Image, Post Formats, and more.
rusty-grunge.description_long:
This theme, which goes by the appropriately evocative name of Rusty Grunge, has all the rusty and grungy elements needed to appeal to all those who embrace grunginess in themes. It is also flexible enough to accommodate different uses, from a personal site, to a music band journal.

The theme comes equipped with options for Custom Background, Menus, and Header Image. It also bears two distinct widget areas, making this theme not only grungy but also highly customizable.

It also has two full width page templates (one shows the header image) you can use to display some pages without the sidebar. Image templates are automatically shown using a full width layout of the site, removing the sidebar.

Widgets

When it comes to widgets, Rusty Grunge has two, distinctly colored sidebars for you to work with.

Post Formats

The theme also supports some of the WordPress formats for posts, which you may check out on the demo site. With them, you can publish Asides, Quotes, and Status posts.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 538 except in the full-width layout where it’s 746.
  2. The sidebar width is 180

p2.name: P2 Classic
p2.author: Automattic
p2.description: Blogging at the speed of thought. P2 transforms a mild-mannered blog into a super-blog with features like inline comments, a posting form right on the homepage, inline editing of posts and comments, real-time updates, and much more.
p2.description_long:
Check out the new, fully responsive, P2 theme.

P2 is a theme for WordPress that transforms a mild-mannered blog into a super-blog with features like inline comments on the homepage, a posting form right on the homepage, inline editing of posts and comments, real-time updates so new posts and comments come in without reloading, and much more.

Visit the P2 site to learn more.

P2 makes a great communication tool for your business or organization. To find out just how, read How P2 changed Automattic.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width width is 648.
  2. The sidebar width is 212.
  3. The header image dimensions are 980 by 120 (width, height).

visual.name: Visual
visual.author: Devin Price
visual.description: A dark, elegant, responsive portfolio theme with a grid layout, perfect for showcasing your art.
visual.description_long:
Visual is a dark, elegant take on the traditional portfolio theme, perfect for showcasing your photography, art, or general interests.

Featured Images

Assign Featured Images to your posts for a grid-based portfolio look. Featured Images will appear just above the post content on index, archive, and search pages at 326 pixels wide with a flexible height.

Widgets

You can configure a sidebar on single posts and pages by going to Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Menu

Assign your own custom menu to the Primary Menu, located in the header, under Appearance → Menus. If no menu is assigned this area will display your Pages by default.

Custom Header and Background

Visual allows you to set a flexible-width or -height custom header under Appearance → Header. You can also customize the theme with a background color or image by going to Appearance → Background.

Full-width Template

Visual comes with a wide page template that removes the sidebar, widening the content area. Activate the template by editing the page in question and setting the Page Template to Full Width, No Sidebar.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The content width is 265 on home, archive, and search pages, and 670 on single posts
  2. The content width on the full-width page template is 960
  3. The sidebar width is 260

wedding.name: Wedding
wedding.author: DesignOrbital
wedding.description: Wedding is an elegant WordPress theme to build a beautiful wedding website easily. Let share your wedding photos, galleries, videos and memorable moments with family & friends by using the wedding WordPress theme.
wedding.description_long:
Wedding is an elegant WordPress theme to build a beautiful wedding website easily. You can share your wedding photos, galleries, videos and memorable moments with family & friends by using the wedding WordPress theme.

Wedding theme is also perfect for photography, travel, or any sort of portfolio site. Sidebars can be set to the left, right, or removed entirely.

Responsive Design

A 100% Responsive, with retina ready, Wedding WordPress Theme is guaranteed to have an ultimate look on a large resolution desktop screens, as well as on various mobile devices’ screens, including tablets, cellphones and other. All contemporary browsers supported too!

Post Formats & Sticky Posts

Wedding supports Post Formats and Sticky Posts. Aside, audio, gallery, image, link, quote and video post formats give your website a beautiful look.

Featured Images

Featured Images are displayed above the post title on the blog index and on single pages.

Blog Layouts

Wedding is powered with different blog layouts. You can choose the following layouts easily via the Customizer.

  • Sidebar/Content Layout
  • Content/Sidebar Layout
  • Content Layout Only

Theme Layouts

You can use Wedding in default wide layout or personalize it with beautiful backgrounds by using the boxed layout via the Customizer.

Wedding Templates

Wedding theme has four powerful templates.

  • Bridesmaid Page
  • Front Page
  • Full Width Page
  • Groomsmen Page

Custom Header & Background

You can personalize your site with a custom header and background via the Customizer. Wedding theme also supports Featured Image Header.

Custom Menus

Wedding allows you to have a custom menu that can be set up by going to Appearance → Menus.

Widget Areas

Wedding comes with five widget areas – one in the right or left sidebar, and up to four in the footer. The footer widget areas will activate once you drag widgets to them in Appearance → Widgets.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 648 except in the full-width and content layout, where it’s 1038.

blogum.name: Blogum
blogum.author: WPShower
blogum.description: Blogum is a simple, clean, and grid-based theme designed in a modern and minimalist style with a great attention to detail. It comes with supports for several post formats, including image, gallery, and aside. Includes a full-width template for dropping the sidebar on pages.
blogum.description_long:
Blogum is a clean and minimalist theme that allows your reader to focus on your content. The beauty of this theme is its simplicity. The grid-based design organizes your blog to present in a modern style.

Post Formats

Blogum includes special styles for Aside, Image and Gallery post formats.

Aside Post Format
Image Post Format
Gallery Post Format


Widgets

Blogum supports a widget area in the right sidebar.

Nice styling feature

Blogum has a nice styling feature for Heading Six. You can display part of your content outside of the main column with the H6 tag. (Max 145px wide)

Custom Appearance

You are able to customize Blogum with the custom background feature, a custom header image, and a custom menu.

No Sidebar Pages

Optionally hide the sidebar on pages using the “Full-width, no sidebar” template option when creating or editing a page. Content on pages using this template will span the entire width of the layout.

Quick Specs:

  1. The maximum content width is 545 pixels.
  2. Full-width layout: The main column is 785 pixels.
  3. The maximum sidebar width is 225 pixels.
  4. The header image is 945 pixels wide and 150 pixels high.
  5. The maximum width for images on attachment pages is 785 pixels.

hatch.name: Hatch
hatch.author: AlienWP
hatch.description: A simple, responsive, and minimal portfolio theme for photographers, illustrators, designers, or photobloggers. Ideal for sites where images are the primary content.
hatch.description_long:
Hatch is a lightweight, bare-bones theme for photographers, illustrators, and visual artists. Your portfolio is certain to stand out with the theme’s bold featured images, full-width posts, and a space for your logo. Read on to find out how to set up your own stunning website with Hatch.

Featured Images

Hatch’s grid-style design relies heavily on featured images, so it looks its best when you assign one to each of your posts. You can do this using the Featured Image meta box when you create or edit a post.

Featured images will appear both on the blog as a preview and full size in single post view. Please note, on single posts the featured image will be duplicated if also included in the post content.

If no featured image is assigned, Hatch will attempt to pull the first attached image in your post. If no image is attached, the theme displays a light gray placeholder.

Theme Options

Hatch allows you to customize your site even further by adding a logo to the left of your site title. You can also add a brief message to your home page to welcome your visitors or introduce your work.

You can find Hatch’s theme options exclusively in the Customizer.

Custom Menu

The Primary Menu is located to the right of your site title, and can be configured by going to Appearance -> Menus.

Custom Header

Hatch supports a flexible-height custom header image, which can be configured under Appearance -> Header.

The header image displays only on the home page, and its size depends on the presence of a welcome message in the theme options. If a welcome message is active, it will take up 66% of the content column, otherwise it will take up the full width of the content column.

Custom Background

Spruce up your site with a custom background color or image by going to Appearance -> Background.

Widgets

Hatch supports five widget areas — one on pages, one after single posts, and three columns in the footer. You can configure these areas by going to Appearance -> Widgets in your Dashboard.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 940 except on Pages, where it’s 640
  2. The full width, no sidebar page template width is 940
  3. The after singular sidebar width is 940
  4. The page sidebar width is 260
  5. The footer sidebar widths are 287

truly-minimal.name: Truly Minimal
truly-minimal.author: FlareThemes
truly-minimal.description: A clean, modern theme that is true to its name, with multiple sidebar placement options and support for all post formats.
truly-minimal.description_long:
Truly Minimal is a clean, modern theme that lives up to its name. With lots of whitespace, classic typography, a responsive design, support for post formats, and multiple sidebar placement options, this theme is perfect for writers, businesses, or anyone who wants a crisp look for their site.

Theme Options

Choose the placement of your sidebar (Left or Right) in the Customizer. You can also select No Sidebar to remove the sidebar entirely for a wider content area. By default, the sidebar is active and located to the right of the content area.

Widgets

You can configure one optional sidebar (if enabled in the Theme Options) by going to Appearance -> Widgets.

Custom Menu

You can assign a custom menu to the primary menu area, located in the header, under Appearance -> Menus. If no menu is assigned, this area will display your Pages by default.

Custom Header and Background

Personalize Truly Minimal with a flexible-width or -height custom header under Appearance -> Header, or apply a background color or image by going to Appearance -> Background.

Full-Width Page Template

If you want to keep the sidebar on your blog but remove it on a page or two, you can use the Full Width, No Sidebar template, set under Page Attributes.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 630, except in the full-width layout, where it is 955
  2. The sidebar width is 263

vintage-camera.name: Vintage Camera
vintage-camera.author: Caroline Moore
vintage-camera.description: An illustrated microblogging theme for the vintage camera enthusiast in six vintage styles/color schemes. Supports post formats, custom menus, custom header and custom backgrounds.
vintage-camera.description_long:
Vintage Camera is a fantastic theme for the classic camera photographer or enthusiast. Using six iconic cameras for inspiration, this theme blends illustration, typography, subtle details, and a responsive design to create a unique look for the retro-photographer in us all.

Theme Styles

Vintage Camera comes packaged with six header illustration/color scheme combinations. Choose the one that most inspires you from Appearance → Theme Options.



…or upload your own custom header image or custom background for a fully-tailored experience.

Custom Menu

Vintage Camera supports a custom menu, with multiple dropdown levels, in the sticky footer that can be customized from Appearance → Menus.

Widgets

Vintage Camera supports three widget areas in the footer that can be customized from Appearance → Widgets.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 730 (in full-width layout).
  2. The width of each widget area is 257 (in full-width layout).
  3. The custom header image is 600 with a suggested height of 300.

shelf.name: Shelf
shelf.author: The Theme Foundry
shelf.description: A unique tumblelog style theme featuring a fluid and responsive design. Looks great on the iPad, iPhone, and other modern mobile devices.
shelf.description_long:
By The Theme Foundry

Be different.

Uniquely horizontal.

We threw out the rulebook when designing Shelf. Instead of a traditional vertical layout, Shelf scrolls horizontally, making it fun and easy for your audience to enjoy your website in a unique way. Shelf was designed specifically for touch devices. Swiping through the layout feels perfectly natural on a tablet or phone. The included keyboard navigation also makes traditional web browsing easy.

Add some style.

Make it your own.

Personalizing your blog should be fun. We’ve leveraged the built-in WordPress customizer, so adding your own background image or color is simple. We’ve also included options to hide what you don’t need, like blog title, tagline, and background title. Combine these options with a custom background to get your blog looking just right.

Watch. Listen. Read.

Share with your audience.

Shelf makes it simple to post any type of content: videos, quotes, links, images, and audio files. Each format has a unique style, tailored to the media you post. This makes for an extremely streamlined and enjoyable reading experience. Your fans will have a blast watching video, listening to music, and reading articles on your website.

Help and additional information

If you need help with Shelf be sure to read through the documentation by clicking the Support button at the top of the sidebar on this page. You can also ask us questions in the WordPress.com Shelf support forum.

Looking to buy Shelf for a self hosted WordPress.org website? The Theme Foundry builds WordPress templates for WordPress.org and you can purchase the Shelf theme for WordPress.org directly from their website.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The max image width is 396.

origin.name: Origin
origin.author: AlienWP
origin.description: Minimalistic, mobile-optimized theme with responsive layout.
origin.description_long:
Origin is a light, elegant theme with a minimalist look and feel, perfect for a blog or journal. Your photos are the focus thanks to featured images and stylized Sticky posts, and the responsive design makes it a great fit for mobile devices and small screen sizes.

Featured Images

If your post has a Featured Image set, it will display as a post thumbnail on the blog index. Post thumbnails are 154 pixels wide, unless you make the post Sticky, in which case they’re the full column width of 640 pixels.

Widget Areas

Origin supports six widget areas:

The Primary sidebar displays search, archives, and meta by default if no widgets are configured in Appearance -> Widgets.

The four Footer Columns and After Post widget areas are optional and will display only when configured. The After Single sidebar is handy for including a brief author description or perhaps a list of tags or categories to help readers more effectively discover your awesome content.

Custom Background and Header

Make Origin your own by adding a custom background or custom header. The custom header will only display if configured in Appearance -> Header.

Custom Menu

Origin supports one custom menu in the header. The theme will fall back to display your pages if the Navigation menu is not configured and saved.

Full Width Page Template

Is that sidebar cramping your style? Give your content some room to breathe by setting individual pages to the Full Width page template included with Origin.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The header image is 940 wide by 150 tall.
  2. The post thumbnails are 154 wide except for Sticky posts where they’re 640 wide
  3. The main column width is 640 except in the full-width layout where it’s 940
  4. The sidebar width is 260

bold-life.name: Bold Life
bold-life.author: jayhafling
bold-life.description: A bold, colorful theme that lends itself well to personal blogs and daily journals.
bold-life.description_long:
Live out loud with this bold, colorful theme. Its fun and vibrant design gives your site a fresh look. Bold Life lends itself well to blogs and journals—but works great for displaying any type of content.

Custom Appearance

Make it yours with the custom background feature, a custom header image, and a custom menu.

Single Column Page Template

Bold Life includes a page template for removing the sidebar on pages. To activate it for a page, simply choose “One column, no sidebar” from the page editor with the “Template” chooser in “Page Attributes” area.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 538 except in the one-column page layout where it’s 658.
  2. The sidebar width is 214.
  3. The header image dimensions are 950 by 264 (width, height).

fruit-shake.name: Fruit Shake
fruit-shake.author: Automattic
fruit-shake.description: Fruit Shake features multiple fruit flavors (color schemes actually, including a secret unlockable one), an optional, one-column, tumblelog layout (just remove the widgets from your sidebar to see it), and all your favorite theme features like custom headers, backgrounds, and menus. It’s a perfectly fruitylicious theme for your blog.
fruit-shake.description_long:
Fruit Shake is an updated, more fruitylicious, successor to the quirky Banana Smoothie theme. Its packed with delicious and fun features and might be just perfect for your blog — even if you’re not obsessed with fruit.

The goal of Fruit Shake was to capture Banana Smoothie’s essence and serve it up to everyone with a refreshed design — and even more fruity flavor. Hence, your choice of three fruit-flavored color schemes: Banana, Blueberry, and my favorite, Dragon Fruit.

And just like, Banana Smoothie did, Fruit Shake comes with its own fruit shake recipe widget that lets you share your love of bananas, blueberries, and dragon fruit with your blog readers. Also, there may or may not be a secret, unlockable, fruit in Fruit Shake. Or not. I can’t say much more than that except, well, it might be a secret. If it even exists.

Of course, if you just like the basic colors of Fruit Shake you can also personalize the design with your own custom header and custom background image. You can even remove all the widgets from the sidebar in Appearance → Widgets and create a sleek tumblelog look for your blog. In other words, you don’t have to be obsessed with fruit to enjoy Fruit Shake. It doesn’t hurt though.

You can even customize the design in Fruit Shake. If you want a one-column look for your blog, simply remove all the widgets from your sidebar. Fruit Shake will shrink down with a leaner layout.

Fruit Shake also supports six Post Formats — Aside, Galley, Link, Image, Quote, and Status — that bring visual variety to your blog by allowing the design to match your writing style.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 524.
  2. The header image is 980 by 285.

basic-maths.name: Basic Maths
basic-maths.author: Automattic
basic-maths.description: Basic Maths is a thoughtful and well-constructed grid theme based on the landmark design of Khoi Vinh’s subtraction.com. One of the best looking, most elegant, and smartest designed blog themes available. Make it yours with custom colors, custom header image, custom menu, and custom background. Originally designed by Khoi Vinh and built by Allan Cole.
basic-maths.description_long:
Basic Maths is one of the best-looking, elegant, and smartly-designed themes we’ve ever seen. If you want to make a statement about how important your content is, Basic Maths might be the answer.

An extraordinary amount of care and attention went into making Khoi Vinh and Allan Cole’s Basic Maths so attractive — and so usable! Let’s take a look at what it can do for your blog.

Basic Maths also offers you the ability to choose your own font colors for your links and make the theme truly your own.

The Options

There are a number of Theme Options that allow you to customize certain areas of Basic Maths. These option can be found at Appearance > Theme Options.

  1. Link Color: Change the color of links, backgrounds and borders by entering a HEX color number.
  2. Hover Color: Change the color of hover links by entering a HEX color number.
  3. Top Tag Count: Choose the number of ‘Top Tags’ to display in the header. (Set to 0 to show all tags.)
  4. Show Categories: Check this box to display a list of Categories in the header instead of Tags.
  5. Archives: Use this option to insert the slug of the page using the Archives template. (example: For a page Titled “History” that uses the Archives template, insert the slug history so that the “All Tags” link points to the correct page).

Grid-tastic!

Every template of Basic Maths is carefully based on a rational, methodical typographic grid for impeccable layout guidance. (Just hit SHIFT + ALT + G to see it on any page!)

Basic Maths is based on the landmark design of Khoi’s own Subtraction.com, so you can rest assured that it’s one of the most thoughtful and well constructed grid-based designs you’ll find anywhere.

Your Images and the Grid

To make the most out of Basic Maths, you should update the sizes of your media uploads. To do so, go to Settings > Media and set the sizes like:

  • THUMBNAIL max width to 170 and the max height to 170 (Be sure to crop the thumbnail).
  • MEDIUM max width to 440. Then set the max height to 440 or larger.
  • LARGE max width to 620. Then set the max height to 620 or larger.

Basic Maths will try its best to correctly display your previously uploaded pictures so you don’t need to re-upload them. You can see how the different possibilities with images are rendered on our demo site.

Menus

Like all our themes, Basic Maths supports Custom Menus that allow you to create your own custom menu links with up to two levels of depth.

Custom Header Logo

Basic Maths allows you to add a custom header image. You need to navigate to Appearance > Header in your Dashboard and follow the on-screen instructions to upload your own custom header images. You can also choose one of the defaults. Near the bottom of that page you can also choose to show or hide your site title over your header image.

Page Templates

This theme includes an Archives page template, which shows a list of all your Tags and Categories along with a date based Archive at the bottom. To use it, edit the page you would like to display the template, and select the Basic Maths Archive Template from the Page Template dropdown menu.

Control the Layout

With Basic Maths you can arrange your content in different ways by using div tags and adding some classes. We have documented this process and showing some examples on the demo site.

Basic Maths theme documentation

scrollider-express.name: Scrollider Express
scrollider-express.author: WooThemes
scrollider-express.description: A clean blogging theme designed by WooThemes.
scrollider-express.description_long:
Scrollider Express is a clean photography / blogging theme with a unique design. With its subtle colors and attention to detail, Scrollider Express is the perfect theme to showcase your photos and content.

Scrollider Express comes bundled with a unique custom header that spans across the full width of your site, perfect to showcase that awesome picture you just took. The content of your homepage scrolls over the header when scrolling, as well as causing the header’s content to fade out, relative to your scrolling.

About The Theme

Easy to customize

Scrollider Express comes with the option to customize the header and the background that make it easy to fit to your site’s personality.

Responsive Design

Nowadays users are visiting sites from an increasing array of devices and browsers. Scrollider Express was built with this in mind, adjusting the layout to accommodate screens of different sizes and orientation.

Two Customizable Menus

Scrollider Express also has two menu areas: a traditional page menu and a second (optional) top menu. You can take control of these two areas in Appearance → Menus by creating your own custom menus and assigning them to either menu location.

Support for Post Formats

Enhance your site with Post Formats by displaying various types of content. Scrollider includes support for the Aside, Image, Video, Quote, Link and Chat Post Formats.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 565.
  2. The sidebar width is 310.

untitled.name: Untitled
untitled.author: Automattic
untitled.description: A nice bold theme. Features full-bleed featured posts and featured images, a fixed header, and subtle CSS3 transitions.
untitled.description_long:
Designed in-house by the amazing Theme Team, Untitled is the absolute perfect theme to showcase your photos and videos. While this theme is best without widgets, it does support a right sidebar.

Features: a full-bleed front page slider, post formats, a mini-carousel slider for single posts, custom colors, custom header (to upload your own logo), and custom background. You can use the mini-carousel slider to navigate around your blog posts without using the normal next/previous links on traditional blogs.

To set up Untitled’s Front Page Slider:

  1. Navigate to Appearance → Customize → Featured Content.
  2. Enter the name of a tag.
  3. Click the blue “Save” button at the bottom.
  4. Create a post with a featured image that’s at least 1024px wide.
  5. Note: The featured image will look best at these dimensions: 1440px wide, 400px tall.
  6. Give the post the tag you declared in step 1.

Posting and the Mini Carousel Slider:

Standard Post Format with Featured Image

Posts with featured images will display as shown above. This format supports galleries, image, video, status, and sticky posts. Standard posts without a featured image, aside, and link post formats will display as normal (with entry content.)

Mini Carousel for Single Pages

To setup the mini carousel, any posts with a featured image, will appear in the mini carousel. Simple!

Activate Untitled today to give your blog the modern look you’ve always wanted!

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 700 except in the full-width layout where it’s 1000.

autofocus.name: AutoFocus
autofocus.author: Allan Cole
autofocus.description: An elegant, minimal theme designed for artists, photographers, and other creatives seeking a simple but beautiful way to showcase their talents online.
autofocus.description_long:
AutoFocus is an elegant, minimal theme designed for artists, photographers, and other creatives seeking a simple but beautiful way to showcase their talents online.

Impressive, Large Featured Images

You’ll immediately notice AutoFocus’ prominent single post featured images, which when set manually are placed front and center, above your post’s title and content. If you would rather have your images more closely integrated into your content then you can certainly do that as well.

Smart, Stunning Archives

All archive views in AutoFocus—the index, category, tag, date-based, and author pages—make it incredibly easy to create stunning website content without going through the hassle of manually setting featured images for every single one of your posts.

Your image placeholders will first search for manually set featured images; if none are found then images that you’ve uploaded to your posts will instead automatically be used. If no images are found for a post, then its date, title, and excerpt will be shown.

Galleries

AutoFocus beautifully responds to not only single image posts but also full galleries. If you would prefer to forego a large featured image above your post content and instead showcase an entire set of photos then simply insert a gallery into your post without manually setting a featured image.

Custom Background and Header

Add a personal touch by uploading a Custom Header Image or by taking advantage of the Custom Background feature.

Custom Menu

You may also customize your site navigation by creating your own Custom Menu. If you decide to hide your site title and description, AutoFocus’ menu will automagically change from a vertical display to a horizontal orientation. This is especially useful in the case of large site menus.

AutoFocus is made for showcasing beautiful work. We can’t wait to see how you show off your artistry with this theme.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main content column width is 590.
  2. The sidebar width is 195.
  3. The header image dimensions are 800 by 216 (width, height).
  4. The maximum width of single post featured images is 800.
  5. Widget-enabled sidebars are enabled on all pages.
  6. Single post sidebars will in lieu of widgets show important post metadata.

forefront.name: Forefront
forefront.author: Automattic
forefront.description: Forefront is a responsive business and corporate theme that helps you to create a strong–yet beautiful–online presence for your business.
forefront.description_long:
Forefront is a fully responsive theme that helps you to create a strong–yet beautiful–online presence for your business. Forefront’s layout adjusts itself depending on the device you are using. This means your site will look good not only on laptop browsers, but also on devices with smaller screens, such as the iPad and iPhone.

Custom Page Templates

Forefront has three custom page templates that are great for business and corporate websites.

Front Page Template

As the name suggests, this template is perfect for the front page where you can introduce your business to the world. Rich, powerful, and flexible, the front page template includes three optional widget areas, a big leading image with a call-to-action, and two testimonials. (See the image at the top.)

When you first activate Forefront, you’ll see your posts in a traditional blog format but if you’d like to use this template as the front page of your site, here is the instruction.

  1. Create or edit a page, and assign it to the Front Page template from the Page Attributes module.
  2. Go to Settings → Reading and set “Front page displays” to “A static page”.
  3. Select the page you just assigned the Front Page template to as “Front page” and then choose another page as “Posts page” to serve your blog posts.

Grid Page Template

The grid template is great for a portfolio page, a case study page, or a page to introduce your team members.

Full Width Page Template

The full-width template gives you plenty of space to embed a map of your office or showreels.

Testimonials

Testimonials from happy customers and clients are important to include on your site to establish trust and encourage potential customers. With Forefront, you can add testimonials easily by going to Testimonials → Add New. You can also add an optional customer image or logo as a featured image.

Two randomly chosen testimonials appear on the front page template so that every testimonial has an equal chance to be there. All testimonials are displayed in a testimonial archive page.

Where is the Testimonial archive page?

Let’s say you have a WordPress.com site at:
http://mygroovysite.wordpress.com/

The URL of the testimonial archive page will be:
http://mygroovysite.wordpress.com/testimonial/

Using the URL as a custom link, you can add a link to the testimonial archive page to your Custom Menu.

Customizing the Testimonial archive page

Once you have published a testimonial, under the Testimonials menu in the Dashboard, you will see a link that takes you to the Customizer where you can edit the page title, add an intro text and a featured image.

Connect

If you connect your site to popular social networking sites such as Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Google Plus or Tumblr with Publicize in Setting → Sharing, you can display links to your profiles on those sites from the Connect in the Customizer.

Widget Areas

Widgets are flexible and great tool to customizing your sites.

Forefront offers four widget areas:

  • Sidebar widget area which appears on the right.
  • Optional footer widget area.
  • Two optional widget areas on the front page template.

Custom Header and Logo

Want to upload your logo? Sure thing! Forefront supports a flexible custom header image with a maximum width of 330 pixels, which you can configure under Appearance → Header.

Customize Even More

Of course Forefront supports Custom Backgrounds so that you can change the background color or image as a background of your site. When you add the Custom Design upgrade, you can change fonts and some key colors so that your site fits with your corporate identity.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. On single posts and the default page template the main column maximum width is 600.
  2. On the full width page template the main column maximum width is 1050.
  3. The featured image works best with images at least 1230 wide for pages, 810 for posts.

picks.name: Takashi Collection
picks.description: Themes by Takashi Irie, designer of the WordPress default theme Twenty Fourteen.

debut.name: Debut
debut.author: Cedaro
debut.description: An eye-catching multimedia theme featuring a unique content carousel and responsive gallery style layout.
debut.description_long:
Debut is an eye-catching multimedia theme featuring a unique content carousel and responsive gallery style layout. Debut comes with a specific set of theme options to help easily customize the layout, functionality, and design of your theme. Some of the features include: customizable hero slider, custom audio player, custom page templates, and a responsive design for all media.

Responsive design

Debut’s “Responsive Design” provides a unique and tailored layout depending on which device (desktop, laptop, tablet or mobile) you are using. This makes Debut not only look great in the browser but also on your iPad, iPhone, or any other mobile device.

Hero Slider

The hero slider in Debut is great to showcase important posts and information. This unique slider comes with a barrage of customization controls. A few featured options include: category, content positioning, content color, slideshow speed, slideshow animation, slideshow direction, slide count, and more.

Featured Content

Debut also helps feature content by adding this section to the Home Page Template and a Featured (Grid) Page Template. There are a few options that come with Debut to help you narrow this content down, some of these options include: category, post count, view, pagination, featured image filter and more.

Audio

Need to let your site be heard? Debut comes with a custom audio player that also includes a playlist functionality. Adding audio is easy:

  1. Select the Audio post format.
  2. Upload the audio (.mp3) you would like to be included in the player.
  3. And that’s it!

Debut will automatically pull the .mp3 audio files from the gallery and insert an audio player at the top of the post. Nice!

NOTE: The Audio post format requires .mp3 type files to play. In order to upload .mp3 files, you must have the space upgrade.

Images

Image posts in Debut utilize the Featured Image to showcase an individual photograph. Setting a featured image and an image post format will display your image at the top of your post.

Galleries & Slideshows

Galleries and Slideshows are easy to set up. You just need to:

  1. Select the Gallery post format.
  2. Upload the images you would like to appear in your gallery or slideshow.
  3. Insert the gallery or slideshow shortcode into your content, and you’re done!

Your gallery will display as thumbnails on the page. When an image is clicked, it displays in a popup slider overlay. The slideshow will display as a slideshow on the page.

Of course, you also have the flexibility to create galleries and slideshow using the Standard post format. The difference being the Gallery icon will not be displayed over featured images.

Videos

Videos also look great in Debut. Just select the Video post format, and paste your embed code or use the WordPress.com standard shortcodes – that’s it! Debut will take the first video embedded and feature it at the top of the post.

Theme Options

In addition to the various supported Post Formats, there are a refined set of options available throughout Debut’s Theme Options page, including:

  • The choice to upload your own custom logo image.
  • Customizable hero slider.
  • Control over the sidebar position.
  • Custom background options
  • The ability to easily add Twitter, Facebook, Vimeo, Youtube and Flickr icons into your footer.
  • Option to provide a custom RSS feed for the RSS icon in the footer.

Quick Specs ( all measurements in pixels):

  1. Debut is a responsive-width design.
  2. Full width content is 860.
  3. Content with sidebar is 550 and sidebar is 200
  4. Hero slider images 940x350

Debut theme documentation

pink-touch-2.name: Pink Touch 2
pink-touch-2.author: Automattic
pink-touch-2.description: A theme that has a stellar mix of color, texture and typography. Designed by Kcmr. It features a custom header, custom background, and maximum three widget areas in the footer. It comes with supports for several post formats including aside, gallery, image, quote, link, chat, and audio.
pink-touch-2.description_long:
Pink Touch 2 has a stellar mix of color, texture, and typography. It pays close attention to detail. The individual design effects are simple and subtle but together they make your blog look very attractive.

Pink Touch 2 is designed with Post Formats in mind. It supports nine formats, — standard, quote, aside, image, gallery, chat, audio, link, and video.

The Quote Format

The Quote format enlarges the font and adds a yellow background color that makes it stand out from the rest.

The Aside, Image, and Video Formats

The Aside, Image, and Video formats each hide the title of your post, letting your readers get straight to the content.

Aside Format
Image Format
Video Format


The Gallery Format

The Gallery Format gives a peek at the photos in the gallery with displaying the latest photo and information about the gallery. Click on the image to view the entire gallery.

The Chat Format

The Chat Format alternates the background and border colors for each paragraph to emphasize the conversation feeling.

The Audio Post Format

The Audio Format adds a player for the audio and it also hides the title of your post.

Note: You’ll need the Space Upgrade for your blog in order to upload audio files.

The Link Format

The Link Format grabs the first link found in the content of the post and makes the post title direct your reader there.

Widgets

Pink Touch 2 supports a maximum three widget areas above the footer. Add your favourite widgets to enrich your blog.

Custom Header, Background, and Menus

Make it yours with a header image, background, and custom menu.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 510.
  2. Header image is 690 in width and 185 in height.

minimum.name: Minimum
minimum.author: StudioPress
minimum.description: Minimum is a stunning execution of “less is more”, which allows you to express everything you’re about, with very little effort.
minimum.description_long:
A stunning execution of « less is more, » the Minimum theme expresses everything you’re about, with very little effort. Clean, elegant, powerful, unfettered, and uncluttered are a just few words that say… Minimum.

Layouts

You can choose from 6 different layout configurations for Minimum. You can have your content on the left with a sidebar on the right, flip that around, have two sidebars or even remove the sidebar altogether.

Plenty of Options

Part of Minimum’s charm is the option for customizing the look of your site. This includes sidebar widget area, two menu areas, and control over what content is displayed in your blog archive pages.

Featured Section

The Minimum theme is a great fit if you publish a personal portfolio site or what to focus the attention of your visitor’s to a main featured area.

Portfolio Section

The Minimum theme also allows you to showcase your latest work, photos, design concepts or other visuals through the Featured Post widget.

Custom Header Image and Background

You can further customize Minimum thanks to the Custom Header and Background options found in Appearance → Header and Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Content and One Sidebar: The main column width is 660 with one sidebar of 250.
  2. Full-width layout: The main column is 960

Mimimum theme documentation

pinboard.name: Pinboard
pinboard.author: Automattic
pinboard.description: A crafty, textured theme with three post column sizes, optional right or left sidebar, and an area for a welcome message.
pinboard.description_long:
Pinboard is a crafty, textured theme that’s sure to please. Create a virtual scrapbook of your favorite things in a fun, textured style, then make the theme your own with all sorts of customization features.

Theme Options

Pinboard includes several nifty theme options to help you customize the look and feel of your site. Change the post size, the placement of your main sidebar, or add a brief welcome message in just a few quick clicks.

Custom Header and Background

If the Theme Options don’t quench your thirst for customizability, Pinboard also supports custom headers and backgrounds. You can configure a flexible-width or -height custom header by going to Appearance -> Header.

Likewise, you can add your own background image by going to Appearance -> Background.

Widget Areas

Pinboard includes one sidebar that can be placed either to the right or left of your content, and up to three additional sidebars in the footer. Configure these areas by going to Appearance -> Widgets.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 536 except in the full-width layout where it’s 820
  2. The primary sidebar width is 200
  3. The large post width is 468
  4. The medium post width is 306
  5. The small post width is 224

sundance.name: Sundance
sundance.author: Automattic
sundance.description: A free video theme brought to you by the folks at Automattic. Despite its minimalist design, Sundance was crafted with clean, elegant typography and close attention to detail. The home page offers a featured video carousel. It supports the video post format, widgets, custom background, custom header, custom menus, and a custom link feature for your social media pages.
sundance.description_long:
Sundance is a free video theme brought to you by the team here at Automattic. Despite its minimalist design, Sundance was crafted with clean, elegant typography and close attention to detail. The home page offers a featured video carousel. It supports the video post format, widgets, custom background, custom header, custom menus, and a custom link feature for your social media pages.

Featured Video Carousel

The Sundance theme offers a featured video carousel on the home page. All you have to do to activate is create a sticky post with the video post format. Then add an excerpt, which appears to the right of the video, as you can see in the screenshot below. Once you have more than one featured video, the arrows and the indicator appear. You are able to feature a maximum of ten posts in the carousel.

Theme Options

Let your users stay in touch! The Sundance theme lets you add social network links on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, and Flickr in the sidebar so that your readers are able to stay connected through these.

Responsive Design

Sundance is designed with responsive design in mind. It provides a tailored layout depending on the device you are using. This makes your blog look good not only on desktop browsers, but also on devices with smaller screens, such as the iPad and iPhone.

Widget Area

Sundance theme offers an optional sidebar with widgets. If you choose to add widgets to the sidebar in Appearance → Widgets they will be displayed in a right-hand sidebar. If you prefer a single-column design, you may leave the sidebar empty as well as disable the social network links and then posts will span the entire width of the layout.

Custom Appearance

Customize Sundance even more with the custom background feature, a custom header image, a custom menu, and a full-width template.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 652 except in the full-width layout, where it’s 874.
  2. Widget width is 186.
  3. The custom header image is 984 by 242 (width, height).

full-frame.name: Full Frame
full-frame.author: Graph Paper Press
full-frame.description: Full Frame is a post-format-loving WordPress theme perfect for showcasing big images, galleries and videos. Tell stories and present work in a unique way.
full-frame.description_long:
Full Frame is a single column, full-width theme for showcasing your beautiful images, galleries, videos from edge to edge. Full Frame is responsive and adapts to different screen sizes so that your website will work (and be optimized for) iPhones, iPads, Android and other mobile devices. Full Frame removes unnecessary clutter and puts the spotlight on your content. Check out the live theme demo to see Full Frame in action.

Text Options

Left Aligned
Center Aligned
Right Aligned
Full Width

The Text Options feature allows you to alter the positioning of the text that overlays your images on the homepage and archive pages. This gives you maximum creative control over the presentation of your posts. For example, if the subject of the featured image is left aligned, you might want the text to overlay the image on the right. You can choose from Default, Left, Center, Right or Full Width alignment options. The Text Options feature is located in the right column underneath the Featured Image metabox.

Post Formats

Full Frame supports six post formats. Each post format further alters the way the post is displayed so you can present images, galleries, videos and quotes in powerful, unique ways.

Standard Post Format

The design of the standard post format shows the post title, date, excerpt and featured image. The Text Options feature (see above) allows you to further adjust the positioning of the text that overlays the featured image. Sweet, eh?

Image Post Format

The image post format shows the post title and date. It doesn't show the excerpt. You can see in the screenshot above why Text Options are so useful: An image with a right aligned subject would call for left-align text.

Gallery Post Format

Like the image post format, the gallery post format shows the post title and the date, but not the excerpt. The example above shows a gallery inserted using the Tiled Gallery" option.

Video Post Format

Like the image and gallery post format options, the video post format shows the post title and date but not the excerpt. The first embeded video is shown as the main content, with the featured image set as the post background image on the home and archive pages.

Aside Post Format

The aside post format shows the post excerpt and date. The title is not shown. The example above uses the Text Options to float the text box to the right so that it balances the post layout and doesn't interfere with the image content.

Quote Post Format

The quote post format shows the content of the post in a blockquote-style design. You can further alter the layout and design of posts assigned this format by using the text options feature.

Arrow & Keyboard Navigation

Use either the arrow keys on your keyboard or the arrow icons at the top right of the theme to navigate up and down between posts appearing on the home and archive pages. Nifty, eh?

Custom Headers

Full Frame supports custom headers, too! If you add a header image, the site description will be shown on top of the header image. Use the site description to introduce your site to your visitors.

Custom Backgrounds

Full Frame supports custom backgrounds. If you don't set a featured image for each post, the custom background will show directly behind each post. This gives you creative control when your posts and pages don't have featured images.

Theme Customizer

Full Frame integrates nicely into the theme customizer and includes two additional options: Logo upload and an option use your custom header image on all posts and pages.

Widgets & Menus

Full Frame has three widgetized areas: Footer Left, Footer Center, Footer Right. Add widgets to all, some, or none of the widgetized areas to customize the layout.

Social Icons

Full Frame supports the following social icons: Twitter, Facebook, WordPress, Google Plus, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Flickr, Vimeo, YouTube and Tumblr.

To create a Facebook link icon do the following:

  1. Visit the Appearance -> Menu page
  2. Create a Custom Link called Facebook and paste the URL to your Facebook page
  3. Click the “Add to Menu” to add your Facebook menu link to a menu
  4. After the Facebook menu item has been added, click the Screen Options link at the top right of the page. (See this screenshot for help.)
  5. Under the “Show Advanced Menu Options” section, make sure CSS Classes is checked. This will add a new input field called “CSS Classes” for each menu item below.
  6. Toggle open the Facebook link that you added above.
  7. In the CSS Classes input field, add “facebook” as the css class.
  8. Repeat this for Twitter (add “twitter”) and Vimeo (add “vimeo”) menu links.

See this screenshot of a correctly filled out menu for showing Facebook, Twitter and Vimeo icons.

picks.name: Featured
picks.description: Used for a showing one featured theme, chosen at random, on home page.

mckinley.name: McKinley
mckinley.author: ThemeTrust
mckinley.description: McKinley is a sleek blog theme based on the awesome TwentyThirteen theme from WordPress.
mckinley.description_long:
McKinley is a theme that lets you make an impact. With full-page width image and video posts formats, this theme enables your content to make a statement.

Slideshow Galleries

McKinley takes your galleries to the next level, showcasing your images in responsive, full-page width slideshows. You don’t have to do anything to get these working; just create a gallery in a post and set the post format to “Gallery” and this theme does the hard work for you.

Featured Images

You can give your posts that extra flair with full-page width Featured Images, which really make your content stand out.

Post Formats

McKinley takes full advantage of Post Formats. You can display images and videos at full-page width, while quotes and links have distinct color-block styles, which add splashes of color.

Along with extra styling for post formats, each post format links to that format’s archive. This allows your readers to easily browse all posts of the same type – for example, all image posts or all video posts.

Responsive design

This theme is designed to look good on any device. It responds to the device not only with an adaptive menu design, but it also has widgets that flow to fit the design.

Adaptive Widgets

The widget area is designed to adapt to fit any design. There is one widget area and you can fill it up with as many widgets as you want. This theme will automatically wrap them into three columns.

Custom Menus, Palettes, Header, and Background

McKinley comes in a great default style, but it’s also built to easily let you create your own look. You can choose from three built-in color palettes, and can also add a Custom Header or Background. The Custom Header is flexible, so you can choose the proportions you want.

The best custom header images are decorative background images. The image will be cropped for small viewports (not scaled down) to fit the available area fixed for height and width. This means header images that work best with this theme are abstract or decorative images.

You can set these up easily: just go to Appearance → Background to set the background or Appearance → Header to set the Header.

This theme comes packed with flexible menus. You can have sub items and even a special menu design just for smaller devices. The custom menu is easily set up by going to Appearance → Menus.

Quick specs all measurements in pixels and maximum measurements on desktop

  1. The main column width is 700.
  2. The footer widget areas are 280.

personal.name: Personal
personal.author: Obox Themes
personal.description: A minimal, content-first theme tailored for writers, journalists and bloggers.
personal.description_long:
Personal is a customizable content-first theme tailored for writers, journalists and bloggers. One of the cleanest and minimal themes in our collection, it promotes your content with its homely feel.

A Striking Home Page

Show off your striking imagery and content

It’s beautiful typography and responsive layout make creating and consuming content a pleasant experience for both the writer and the reader.

It’s Mobile Friendly

You site will look amazing on all devices

By using a mobile-friendly theme you know that any visitor to your website will be having the best experience no matter what device it is they’re using.

  • Mobile-friendly on any modern phone or tablet.
  • Looks great to all of your site visitors.
  • No need for extra mobile-plugins.
  • Works from the moment you activate your theme.

Check out Personal’s demo site!

Quick Specs (measurements in pixels)

  1. Whole site 940 wide
  2. Main content is 620 wide
  3. Sidebar is 280
  4. Videos in video posts are 620 wide

mimbopro.name: Mimbo Pro
mimbopro.author: Pro Theme Design
mimbopro.description: A classically designed magazine theme, with flexible widget sidebars, custom header and background images, and custom footer widgets.
mimbopro.description_long:
Mimbo Pro is a magazine theme for WordPress. Unlike a traditional blog theme it takes your content and formats it in a structured way grouped by category. Using all of the standard WordPress functionality, custom headers, custom backgrounds, post thumbnails, custom navigation and more – Mimbo Pro makes your content look awesome.

Featured Content

At the top of the homepage is a featured content space. This lets you show off your most important content. By default you Mimbo Pro displays all posts here – however you can restrict the content to specific categories by using the theme control panel – and selecting a featured category.

Carousel

Mimbo Pro features a homepage carousel that shows off your featured content. You can edit the carousel settings through the theme options.

Admin Panel to control homepage settings

The carousel options allow you to change the carousel categories, the scroll speed of the category. 0 = no automatic scrolling, and a number greater than 0 is the amount of time to pause between scrolling. If you want you can also hide the carousel by selecting the hide option in the category selection.

Custom Colours

Mimbo Pro allows you to edit the theme colours from the theme customiser. This is a powerful feature that gives you the ability to make the theme fit your design and branding as closely as possible.

Category Summaries

Mimbo Pro allows you to display your categories on the homepage along with the 4 latest posts. We call this section the category summaries. By default all categories are displayed, however you can limit the theme to specific categories through the control panel.

Custom Sidebars

Mimbo Pro uses a series of custom sidebars to allow you to keep things nice and flexible.

  • Sidebar Left – the default left hand sidebar.
  • Sidebar Right – the right hand sidebar as displayed on the homepage.
  • Sidebar Single Post Left – the left hand sidebar to use on single post pages. This is optional, if you leave it empty then the Sidebar Left will be used.
  • Sidebar Single Post Right – This is another optional sidebar. Leave it empty and it will be hidden. Add widgets and it will be displayed on the single posts pages within the post content.
  • Bottom Widgets – footer widgets. These will be displayed side by side in the footer. It’s recommended that you use 3 widgets since there are three columns, however you can use as many as you like.

Custom Widgets

Mimbo Pro includes some custom widgets that are unique to the theme.

  • Upcoming Posts – this widgets lists any posts that you have scheduled for posting in the future.
  • Related Posts (by category) – lists other posts that are in the category/ categories that the current post is in.
  • Popular Posts – lists posts ranked by comment count. The more comments a post has, the more popular it must be!
  • Author Details – displays some information about the post author. Only shows on the single post pages and won’t be visible on archive pages, or the homepage.

Custom Templates

Mimbo Pro includes some custom page templates. These give you some additional functionality that you wouldn’t get with a normal theme.

  • Archives – A chronological list of all posts published on your blog.
  • Full Width Page – A normal WordPress page, only it has the sidebars removed so that you can have content that stretches the full width of the site.
  • Image Gallery – A page that displays all the image attachments on the site and links to their respective pages – nice for visual sites.
  • Sitemap – A complete list of all website posts and pages.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 630 except in the full-width layout where it’s 916.
  2. The sidebar width is 250.

on-a-whim.name: On a Whim
on-a-whim.author: Automattic
on-a-whim.description: A colorful and whimsical blogging theme designed by Meagan Fisher.
on-a-whim.description_long:
On a Whim is a bold and colorful blogging theme, with a touch of whimsy. It's your perfect partner for chronicling your thoughts, flights of fantasy, adventures, and escapades.

Widget Areas

Special Widget Styling

On a Whim includes one primary sidebar. Add your favorite widgets by going to Appearance → Widgets. If you add multiple widgets, every other widget will appear inside a cool box with a little heart icon above it.

Custom Menus

On a Whim features two custom menu areas — a primary menu in the header, and an optional secondary menu in the footer. Create and add menus by going to Appearance → Menus.

Post Formats

On a Whim supports the following post formats: Standard, Aside, Image, Video, Quote, Link, and Gallery.

Social Icons

From the customizer, you can add optional links to your profiles on Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, and YouTube.
