These links will appear as icons in two places: to the right of the main menu in the header, and in the left column of the footer area (below the footer menu if you have a footer menu active).

Social Icons in the header main menu area
Social Media icons in the footer area

Custom Header and Custom Background

On a Whim supports a small, 80-pixel wide custom header image that appears in the right column, above the sidebar. Smaller images really work best —it's meant to serve as a logo, or identifying mark. If you don't add a custom header image, On a Whim will display the site owner's Gravatar by default.

Upload a custom header image under Appearance → Header, and set a custom background color or image by going to Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column has a maximum width of 602.
  2. The right sidebar width is 216.

picks.name: Featured
picks.description: Used for a showing one featured theme, chosen at random, on home page.

collective.name: Collective
collective.author: Organic Themes
collective.description: A theme for small businesses with an emphasis on staff or collaboration.
collective.description_long:
Created for showcasing people, projects, or artwork, Collective is perfect for multi-author blogs, associations, portfolios and more. Whether you’re partnering with others in a new venture, creating a portfolio, or showcasing members of an organization — Collective is beautifully designed and crafted for the job.

Homepage Template

Collective features a flexible Homepage Template layout. Display featured Pages, Posts and Team Members. In addition, the logo, optional footer widgets and social media links offer more flexibility — allowing you to customize the theme layout to match your style and brand.

Responsive Layout

Collective boasts a fluid responsive layout — so the theme will display beautifully across mobile devices. Images, widgets, and content will scale up and down seamlessly when resizing the browser window. Whether viewing the site on the phone, or presenting to a client on a tablet, you can feel confident Collective will maximize the viewing experience.

Team Members Page Template

Collective features a Team Page Template that can be used to showcase people or projects. Posts assigned to the Team page will display with a different layout showcasing personal profiles.

Portfolio Page Template

Collective features a Portfolio Page Template that can be used to showcase projects or artwork. The Portfolio Template features a filterable category menu, and is capable of displaying posts in a one, two, or three column layout.

Page Templates

In addition to the previously mentioned templates, Collective also includes a Full Width Template, Featured Content Slideshow Template, Traditional Slideshow Template, Site Archives Template, and a Three Column Template for displaying content in a variety of different ways. Page Templates can be changed in the Page Attributes module.

The Other Goodies

Many other features you’ve come to know and love with WordPress.com are also available with Collective — including the Custom Header and Background, Custom Menus, and more!

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 800.
  2. The sidebar width is 280.
  3. The footer widget area widths are 264.
  4. Featured Images are 1600 wide by unlimited height on Sticky posts, and 1600 by 600 as header images on single posts and pages.

gallery.name: Gallery
gallery.author: UpThemes
gallery.description: A grid-based theme with masonry layout, infinite scroll, and single column post layouts.
gallery.description_long:
by UpThemes

This is the third iteration of one of the most popular gallery-style WordPress themes on the planet. Gallery is back with a more beautiful design, clean typography, customizations galore, and the best part? It’s now available on WordPress.com!

Customizable Header and Background Image

Change Gallery to fit your own personal style by setting a custom header image, text color, and background image or color. The possibilities are literally wide open! Better yet, purchase the Custom Colors add-on and open up a whole new world of color schemes and beautiful images to choose from!

Note: The custom header looks best with a decorative background image, not a logo that’s designed to be displayed at a specific size.

Minimal Style, Maximum Flexibility

At first glance, the Gallery theme is very minimal, with a white background and very clean layout, but once you start adding your own flair, Galley takes on your personality and style.

Supports Rdio, Spotify, Soundcloud, Instagram, Youtube, Vimeo and Much More!

Gallery makes it easy to embed media from your favorite websites, all displayed on both single posts and grid layouts. That means users don’t have to click on the title of a post just to watch or hear the things you’ve shared! There is truly no other theme that offers this kind of flexibility in sharing stuff you love.

Hashtag All The Things!

We’ve reinvigorated tagging by making tags look and work like hashtags. That means you can add a variety of hashtags to your posts and create collections of related items.

Publicize Your Social Media Presence

Connect your social media accounts instantly! Add your social media accounts as links in the navigation menu.

Keep People’s Attention With Infinite Scroll

The beautiful masonry layout looks great when Infinite Scroll is enabled, keeping your audience captivated as they scroll through an endless wall of posts.

Add a Site Logo

Gallery lets you upload a Site Logo – and allows you to keep your logo when you switch to another theme that supports the Site Logo feature. No need to upload a new image for the header, simply upload your logo once and take it with you no matter what.

able.name: Able
able.author: Automattic
able.description: A multipurpose, traditional blog theme which contains up to a large three-column layout that is clean, responsive, and highly readable.
able.description_long:
Able is a multipurpose traditional blog theme that is a refresh of two older classics, Andreas 04 and Andreas 09.

It retains the spirit of its predecessors — Able contains up to a three-column layout, a grayscale color scheme, and large layout — while offering an updated look that is clean, responsive, and highly readable.

Custom Background and Header

Add a personal touch by uploading a Custom Header Image or by taking advantage of the Custom Background feature.

Custom Menus

Two custom menus are supported. The Primary Navigation Menu will fall back to a list of pages if it has not been manually configured and saved, while the Footer Menu—which is shown at the bottom of your site—will only be displayed if it has been manually configured and saved.

Full Width Page Template

Able comes with a full width page template, which means that even if you use sidebars throughout your website you will still be able to display full width page features on an as-needed basis.

Responsive Design

Able is a responsive theme, adapting to the screen sizes of iPhones, iPads and other mobile devices. Want to see it in action? Grab the corner of your browser window and make the window smaller or open your site using a mobile device!

Quick Specs

Custom Header (all measurements in pixels)

  • The header image dimensions are 1280 by flexible value (width, height). The header must be shown at 1280 wide but any height will do.

Content Width (all measurements in pixels)

  • No widgets active, single column post layout: 1176 maximum content width
  • Left Sidebar Widget or Right Sidebar Widget active: 869 maximum content width
  • Left Sidebar Widget and Right Sidebar Widget active: 562 maximum content width

Sidebars (all measurements in pixels)

  • Left Sidebar: 207 maximum content width
  • Right Sidebar: 207 maximum content width

Keep in mind that the above values assume that the theme is being viewed at its maximum width (1280). This theme is responsive, so on smaller screens the above values will be smaller than stated.

bushwick.name: Bushwick
bushwick.author: James Dinsdale and Automattic
bushwick.description: Bushwick is a lightweight, responsive blogging theme, designed to show beautiful content alongside beautiful imagery.
bushwick.description_long:
Bushwick is a lightweight, responsive blogging theme, designed to showcase beautiful content alongside beautiful imagery.

Custom Excerpts

If you’ve crafted an excerpt for your post, Bushwick will display it between the title and the content, to give readers a quick summary of the content.

Slide-out widget area

You can configure one optional sidebar by going to Appearance → Widgets. It will be displayed above the main navigation when the browser window is wider than 1024px. By default, the sidebar is hidden. To activate it, simply click the bars on the upper right side of your blog and your widgets will slide out.

Custom Menu

You can assign your own custom menu to the primary menu, located in the header, under Appearance → Menus. If no menu is assigned this area will display your pages by default.

Note: If you add a link to your homepage by entering a custom link to http://YOURSITE.wordpress.com/, it will automatically be shifted to the left of your screen, on top of the image. If you’d prefer the link to appear in your menu as normal, create a custom menu item for your homepage by entering the URL like this instead: http://YOURSITE.wordpress.com, without the ending /, and it will appear in the main menu.

Custom Header

Bushwick allows you to set a flexible-width or -height custom header under Appearance → Header. If you set a featured image on an individual post or page, that image will be displayed on the single post or page view, instead of the default custom header.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 640.
  2. The suggested header image size is 900 wide and 1600 high.

zoren.name: Zoren
zoren.author: Fabthemes
zoren.description: A Flexible and Versatile Free WordPress Theme for Personal Bloggers released by fabthemes.com
zoren.description_long:
Meet Zoren, a flexible, versatile, and responsive theme designed to show off your content with simplicity and elegance. Zoren supports multiple post formats — Aside, Audio, Gallery, Image, Link, Quote, Video — widgets, and the option to upload a custom header and custom background image.

Widgets

You can configure your sidebar by going to Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Menu

You can assign a custom menu to the Primary menu area, located in the header, under Appearance → Menus. If no menu is assigned, this area will display your Pages by default.

Custom Header and Background

With Zoren, you can easily add your own custom header image under Appearance → Header, or apply a background color or image by going to Appearance → Background.

Left: Custom Header — Right: Custom Background

Full Width, No Sidebar Page Template

Zoren includes a full-width page template if you want to keep the sidebar on your blog but remove it on a page. You can use the Full Width, No Sidebar template, by selecting it under Page Attributes.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 800 except in the full-width layout where it is 1100.
  2. The sidebar width is 240.

watson.name: Watson
watson.author: The Theme Foundry
watson.description: A polished magazine theme with a touch of class. Perfect for photojournalists, bloggers and authors who prefer long-format content.
watson.description_long:
By The Theme Foundry

Bold and sophisticated.

Your content deserves the best.

Watson was influenced by the bold strokes and clean lines of classic newspapers and magazines. We obsessed about the typography, ensuring your words were clear and readable. We made strong choices — emphasizing your content, while cutting out the cruft. The sidebar disappears when viewing a individual post, maximizing and clarifying the reading experience. Give your posts that professional feel with ten built-in typographic styling options.

Add some style.

Make it your own.

Personalizing your new website should be fun. We’ve leveraged the built-in WordPress customizer, so adding your own background image or color is easy. On top of that, you can use the Custom Design upgrade to set your own primary color for links and buttons with the built in color picker. Combine these colors with a custom background to match your brand and give your website a truly unique look.

Get noticed.

Feature your articles.

We built a simple slider into the Watson front page to help your important articles get more attention and give your website that polished look. Check a box while writing a post and it will automatically show up in the slider. We’ve also included an optional row of thumbnails for any additional featured stories you want to mix in to the home page.

Help and additional information

If you need help with Basis be sure to read through the Watson documentation by clicking the Support button at the top of the sidebar on this page. You can also ask us questions in the WordPress.com Watson support forum.

Looking to buy Watson for a self hosted WordPress.org website? The Theme Foundry builds WordPress templates for WordPress.org and you can purchase the Watson theme for WordPress.org directly from their website.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Watson is a flexible-width, responsive design.
  2. Slider and featured images should be at least 608 by 400.
  3. On single posts and the default page template: The main column maximum width is 492.
  4. On the with-sidebar and sitemap page templates: The main column maximum width is 550.
  5. On the full-width page template: The main column maximum width is 900.
  6. All images and video will scale to fit the viewing screen.

sempress.name: SemPress
sempress.author: Matthias Pfefferle
sempress.description: SemPress is a respsonsive theme perfect for personal blogs. Rebuilt for WordPress.com.
sempress.description_long:
Meet SemPress, an extremely lightweight, responsive theme designed to show off your posts, quotes, and images. SemPress supports multiple post formats, widgets, and the option to upload a custom header image.

Widgets

You can configure your sidebar by going to Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Header and Background

With SemPress, you can easily add your own custom header image under Appearance → Header or background pattern by following these simple instructions Appearance → Background.

Full-Width Page Template

SemPress includes a full-width page template if you want to keep the sidebar on your blog but remove it on a page. You can use the Full Width Page Template, by selecting it under Page Attributes.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 664 except in the full-width layout where it’s 950

anthem.name: Anthem
anthem.author: The Theme Foundry
anthem.description: A responsive and minimalist tumblog style theme for photographers, artists, and creatives. Supports the image, gallery, audio, video, chat, link, and quote formats. Displays beautifully on any device.
anthem.description_long:
By The Theme Foundry

Clean and focused.

Sharing made simple.

Anthem was designed with an intense focus on simplicity. We cut out the cruft and obsessed over all the small details. Everything was about the work and the words. We think the result is a perfect fit for artists, photographers, or other creatives looking for a clean blog design to share their images, videos, music, and articles.

Add some style.

Make it your own.

Personalizing your blog should be fun. We’ve leveraged the built-in WordPress customizer, so adding your own background image or color is easy. We’ve also included options to hide what you don’t need, like author’s name, categories, and post navigation. Combine these options with a custom background to get your blog looking just right.

Watch. Listen. Read

Share with your audience.

Anthem makes it simple to post any type of content: videos, quotes, links, images, galleries, audio files, and even chats. Each format has a unique style, tailored to the media you post. This makes it easy and enjoyable for your audience to watch video, listen to music, and read articles.

Help and additional information

If you need help with Anthem be sure to read through the documentation by clicking the Support button at the top of the sidebar on this page. You can also ask us questions in the WordPress.com Anthem support forum.

Looking to buy Anthem for a self hosted WordPress.org website? The Theme Foundry builds WordPress templates for WordPress.org and you can purchase the Anthem theme for WordPress.org directly from their website.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Anthem is a flexible-width, responsive design.
  2. The main column maximum width is 1240.

standard.name: Standard
standard.author: WooThemes
standard.description: Standard is a meticulously designed, hand-crafted theme for professional blogging. It adapts to mobile devices and individual posts can be styled distinctly for words, images, quotes, links, videos, or statuses using post formats.
standard.description_long:
Standard is a sleek, exacting theme designed for professional blogging with an emphasis on contextual display of your content. Whether you’re posting text, images, videos, or quotes, your content will be uncluttered and sophisticated from desktop to mobile and everything in between.

Six Beautiful Post Formats

Your content, in each of it’s various forms, deserves to be presented with unique distinction. Thanks to Standard’s support of post formats, it can.

Desktop, Tablet, & Mobile Ready

Standard’s responsive layout ensures easy browsing for tablet & mobile visitors by adapting your content to fit their screen. Forget pinching, zooming, swiping, and side-to-side scrolling. Because Standard is a mobile theme, these frustrations have been removed.

Retain & Engage Readers

Attract your first-time readers into deeper content and wider conversation by adding Standard’s Activity Tabs widget to your sidebar.

Additional Features

Standard also includes:

  • Native WordPress support to upload your own logo or header image.
  • Native WordPress support to change the background color or upload a background image.
  • Social media icons (Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Pinterest, Vimeo, YouTube).
  • Support for a left sidebar, right sidebar, or full width/no sidebar layout.
  • Support for navigation above the header, below the header, or in the footer.
  • Support for 3 widget areas in the footer.
  • Support for RTL languages.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 580.
  2. The sidebar width is 300.
  3. The header image is 940 wide and 250 high.

Standard theme documentation

partner-mlb-fan.name: MLB "Fan"
partner-mlb-fan.author: MLB
partner-mlb-fan.description: The Official Major League Baseball “Fan” theme for WordPress.com is loud and vibrant, as every good baseball fan should be. By activating this theme, you agree to the MLB terms of service.
partner-mlb-fan.description_long:
The Official Major League Baseball “Fan” theme for WordPress.com is loud and vibrant, as every good baseball fan should be.

By activating this theme, you agree to the MLB terms of service and to sharing your username and email address with MLB.

superhero.name: Superhero
superhero.author: Automattic
superhero.description: Give your blog a clean look with bright pops of color. Superhero features full-bleed featured posts and featured images, a fixed header, and subtle CSS3 transitions.
superhero.description_long:
Give your blog a clean look with bright pops of color. Superhero features a heroic full-bleed Featured Content area, full-bleed featured images, a fixed header, and subtle CSS3 transitions.

Featured Content Section

To set up Superhero’s Featured Content area, which supports up to ten featured posts:

  1. Navigate to Appearance → Customize → Featured Content.
  2. Enter the name of a tag.
  3. Click the blue “Save” button at the bottom.
  4. Create a post with a featured image that’s at least 960px wide.
    • Note: The featured image will look best at a 2.88:1 width-to-height ratio, and at least 500px tall.
  5. Give the post the tag you declared under Appearance → Customize → Featured Content.

Widget Areas

Superhero has a widget area sidebar that appears everywhere in the site (except when using the Full-Width page template. It can be setup in Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Menus

Superhero has a single, primary custom menu area in the header, that can be set up by going to Appearance → Menus.

Custom Header and Background

Superhero features a Custom Header that can be set under  Appearance → Header. The background can also be customized under Appearance → Background.

Full-Width Page Template

If you would like to remove the sidebar from a page, assign it the Full Width template under Page Attributes.

Available on WordPress.org

If you love the look of Superhero, but have a self-hosted WordPress blog, have no fear, Superhero is… already available for download! Check it out in the WordPress.org theme directory.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 645 except in the full-width layout where it’s 910.
  2. The primary sidebar width is 190.
  3. The Featured Content image size is at least 960 wide.
  4. Individual post featured image is at least 645 wide.

hum.name: Hum
hum.author: Daryl Koopersmith
hum.description: A responsive theme designed to show off a stream of posts, quotes, and images. Add a custom logo to stand out from the crowd. Hum builds off Twenty Eleven, so you get all of the goodness of a WordPress core theme included.
hum.description_long:
Meet Hum, a light, responsive theme designed to show off a stream of posts, quotes, and images. Based on Twenty Eleven, Hum lets your content stand out with support for multiple post formats, a Showcase page template, space for a logo, a sleek fixed left sidebar and custom menu, several widget areas, and more!

Custom Menu

The handy fixed* sidebar with custom menu keeps your site navigation at the ready. You can configure this by going to Appearance -> Menus and assigning a Primary Menu.

* Note: the fixed style means a small number of menu items work best in this area — menus with lots of items may run off the edge of the screen, rendering them inaccessible. Also, long site titles or site titles with long words may get cut off at narrower screen sizes — this theme works best with site titles that are fairly short in length.

Widget Areas

Hum supports one Main Sidebar just after the content, three widget areas in the site footer, and an additional widget area (Showcase Sidebar) on the Showcase page template. You can configure these areas by going to Appearance -> Widgets.

Showcase Page Template

To get started with the custom Showcase page template you need to create a page for it. Choose the Showcase Template under page templates in any page, save it, and assign it as the front page in Settings → Reading. This will change your site from the standard Hum blog look to Hum’s fancy showcase. You still have your regular blog list at hand for several views, like categories, searches, and tags, and you can specify another page to work as your blog if you want to.

To add posts to the Featured Post section just mark some posts as Sticky. That’s all there is to it.

To have a big featured image, you need to use an image that is at least 740px x 288px. Also, make sure you have a set size for Large image under Settings → Media that allows for such sizes.

To populate the sidebars’ Ephemera Widget, you can make use of the Aside or Link post formats when you create a new entry (or convert an old one).

And if you want an introductory text message, just write it in the content of your Showcase page and it will appear on your site. And that’s it!

Custom Header and Background

You can configure a flexible-height custom header that will display in the left sidebar by going to Appearance -> Header — this feature is particularly useful for a logo or other small image:

You can also change the background image or color by going to Appearance -> Background.

Pull Quotes

You can dress up your posts by «pulling» blockquotes out of the content with a class of “pull” and “alignleft” or “alignright”. You can also add a class of just “pull” if you want a more dynamic blockquote that extends out on both sides. Here are some examples of how to do that in the post HTML editor.

</pre>
<blockquote>
A normal blockquote</blockquote>
<blockquote class="pull">
A bolder blockquote that extends into both margins</blockquote>
<blockquote class="pull alignleft">
A bolder blockquote that floats into the left margin</blockquote>
<blockquote class="pull alignright">
A bolder blockquote that floats into the right margin</blockquote>
<pre>

  2. The main sidebar width is 627
  3. The footer sidebar widths are 627 with one sidebar active, 302 with two sidebars active, and 194 with all three sidebars active. (Due to the responsive design, these widths will change depending on the size of the screen.)
  4. The Showcase page sidebar width is 627

eventbrite-venue.name: Eventbrite Multi Event
eventbrite-venue.author: Voce Platforms
eventbrite-venue.description: Use this theme to promote your Eventbrite events or your venue and connect with your audience before and after events with news updates, comments, and social sharing.
eventbrite-venue.description_long:
We’ve teamed up with our partner Eventbrite to bring you this theme. Eventbrite Multi Event is the go-to theme for event planners or venues who want to build a sophisticated and modern destination for promoting events and engaging with their audience.

Event-specific Pages

It’s a no brainer that once you connect your Eventbrite account your event information will automatically be fed into this theme. But we’ve taken it one-step further — we have also included three built-in page templates that’ll make your site shine:

  • Featured Event List page — display a list of your upcoming events, and choose a few to highlight in a carousel when you set them as “Featured Events" in your Theme Options page. This is the perfect page to set as your front page.
  • Event List page — displays a list of your upcoming  events.
  • Calendar page — for the visually inspired, we have a monthly calendar view.

Sample Featured Event List page:

Sample Event List page:

Here’s what it looks like when you click on an individual event:

Sample Calendar page:

You can find how to set these pages by going to your Theme Options page under Appearance >> Theme Options or visit our support page.

Make it Your Own

We built this theme have ton of flexibility and customization options so you can build your own event brand or identity. You can upload custom header under Appearance >> Header, whether it’s a logo or an image.

This theme has a right sidebar for you to customize to your heart’s desire. Make sure to play around with the theme-specific widgets — one to feature your latest events (Eventbrite Just Announced) —

and a free-from text widget (Eventbrite Introduction) to tell the readers a little bit about you and your event:

Not to mention the cool Eventbrite Calendar widget that’s available to everyone:

Go to Appearance >> Widgets to check these out.

The Importance of Sharing

Social sharing is one of the most important and effective methods to get the word out about an event, to attract new attendees and most importantly to stay connected with your audience. This theme comes loaded with all the bells and whistles of making sharing easy — whether it’s adding a share button, or adding a twitter timeline, or just a simple follow blog widget — we’ve gotten you covered.

For more information about how to set up the best site with this theme, please visit our support page.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 705
  2. The sidebar width is 320

bloggy.name: Bloggy
bloggy.author: Anariel Design
bloggy.description: Bloggy is an easy to use theme with responsive layout that looks great on any device, big or small. Bloggy features different post formats, each displayed in their own unique way. If you want to make your blog post more flexible you can use different kinds of post formats such as image, gallery, video, aside, link or quotes.
bloggy.description_long:
Bloggy is a simple and beautifully crafted responsive theme for bloggers. It features custom header image, post formats and different page templates to help you customize the theme.

Responsive Layout

Bloggy is highly responsive and will present your site in the best possible light on smartphones, tablets, laptops as well as on large desktop screens.

Features

Bloggy allows you to customize your site title, custom header, background, and menu.

Page Templates

To make it easy to add variety to your site, Bloggy offers an about page template, a full-width template, and a full-width template without the header.

Post Formats

Bloggy supports Post Formats and Sticky Posts. Style your website with aside, audio, gallery, image, link, quote, chat, status, and video post formats.

Featured Images

Featured Images are displayed above the post title on the blog front page and single-post page.

Widget Areas

Bloggy comes with four widget areas – one right sidebar, and three in the footer. The widget areas will activate once you add widgets to them in Appearance → Widgets.

With the Custom Design upgrade, Bloggy makes it easy to create your dream site by changing the fonts and colors, or adding your own custom CSS.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Custom header image width is 1920.
  2. The main column width is 964.
  3. The sidebar width is 264.
  4. The footer widget area widths are 392.
  5. Featured Images are 964 wide by unlimited height on posts.

on-demand.name: On Demand
on-demand.author: Press75
on-demand.description: A video centric theme with a unique content carousel to make your videos stand out and accessible.
on-demand.description_long:
The On Demand WordPress theme is perfect for virtually any video-centric website. You can use any embeddable video format from any video service (such as Vimeo, YouTube, etc.).

Designed for Video

On Demand was designed for Video, which means that your video content will be front and center, just how it should be. Adding video to a post is very simple, just select the Video post format and then paste your embed code or use the WordPress.com standard shortcodes – that’s it! On Demand will take the first video embedded and feature it at the top of the post as shown in the On Demand theme demo.

The Theme Options Page

Featured Content Galore

The On Demand theme includes several options for creating featured content. The home page for example includes a full width content carousel which you can use to feature posts from any selected category. Below the content carousel, you can display up to 8 featured categories (like channels). Clicking any featured category will display the latest posts added to that category. You can also choose to display posts from a selected category on the home page or just the latest posts from every category. On Demand comes with a custom featured content widget which allows to to feature content from any selected category within the sidebar of the theme.

Theme & Customization Options

The On Demand theme includes several theme options that allow you to customize and manage your content with ease. You can upload a custom logo image, change your background color or image and update your featured content settings (described above) right from the theme options page.

Custom Menus

The main menu above the featured content carousel supports custom menus allowing you to configure your site navigation however you like. Add social media links, categories and pages in any order. On Demand also supports multi-level drop-down menus as well for child menu items.

Full Width Page Template

On Demand comes with a full width page template, which means that even if you use sidebars throughout your website you will still be able to display full width page features on an as-needed basis.

On Demand theme documentation

snap.name: Snap
snap.author: The Theme Foundry
snap.description: A lightweight and responsive theme designed to help you showcase your creative projects online. Multiple page templates and a grid based blog layout ensure your website stays flexible and professional.
snap.description_long:
By The Theme Foundry

Showcase your work.

It’s never been easier.

Snap makes it simple to show off your work to your clients, customers, and fans. Quickly create a new portfolio item and include images, videos, and text. Then, use the portfolio page builder interface to drag, drop, and organize your projects. You can even create multiple portfolio pages to display different types of work.

Add some style.

Make it your own.

Personalizing your new website should be fun. We’ve leveraged the built-in WordPress customizer, so adding your own background image or color is easy. On top of that, you can use the Custom Design upgrade to add a custom color scheme. Combine a custom color scheme with a custom background to give your website a truly unique look.

Curate your home page.

Your best work front and center.

Snap’s flexible home page introduces you and you work. There are three distinct sections: the featured slider section, for showcasing your best work or any important blog posts; the about section, where new readers learn about you and your business; and a grid section, where you can feature blog posts or portfolio items. You have complete control over each section and if you don’t set up the slider it will automatically be hidden.

Help and additional information

If you need help with Snap be sure to read through the documentation by clicking the Support button at the top of the sidebar on this page. You can also ask us questions in the WordPress.com Snap support forum.

Looking to buy Snap for a self hosted WordPress.org website? The Theme Foundry builds WordPress templates for WordPress.org and you can purchase the Snap theme for WordPress.org directly from their website.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Snap is a flexible-width, responsive design.
  2. Images and videos will scale to fit the viewing screen.
  3. The featured slider should be at least 994 by 650.
  4. On single posts and the Default page template the main column maximum width is 651.
  5. On the Full Width page template the main column maximum width is 994.

comet.name: Comet
comet.author: Frostpress
comet.description: A very classy, lightweight, and content-focused theme, customizable to your liking. Includes seven color schemes, four layout options, and a full-width page template.
comet.description_long:
Comet sports a lightweight, faded design with simple and classy typographic touches. It’s a great theme for any type of blog, and it works really well for showcasing your writing and photos.

Theme Options

Make it yours by choosing from seven color schemes: (Blue, Gray, Red, Yellow, Green, Teal, and Purple) and four different layout options (two-columns with Content-Sidebar or Sidebar-Content; three columns with Sidebar-Content-Sidebar, or one-column with Content) from the options found at Appearance → Theme Options.

El pase de diapositivas requiere JavaScript.

Custom Appearance

Customize Comet even more with the custom background feature, a custom header image, and a custom menu.

No Sidebar Pages

Optionally hide the sidebar on pages using the “Full Width” template option when creating or editing a page. Content on pages using this template will span the entire width of the layout.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 600 except in the full-width layout where it’s 900.
  2. Sidebar width is 270.
  3. Header image size is 960 by 200 (width, height).

healthy-living.name: Healthy Living
healthy-living.author: Anariel Design
healthy-living.description: Healthy Living is a fresh, simple, and well-rounded blogging theme. With its laid-back, modern design, and beautiful typography, this theme gives your content the deserved spotlight and draws your readers right in. It is fully responsive and includes different page templates, post formats, and a custom header image to expand your customizing options.
healthy-living.description_long:
Healthy Living is fresh and simple blogging theme. With it’s laid-back modern design and a beautiful typography, this theme spotlights your content and draws readers right in. It features custom header image, post formats and different page templates to help you customize the theme.

Responsive Layout

Healthy Living is highly responsive and will present your site in the best possible light on smartphones, tablets, laptops as well as on large desktop screens.

Features

Healthy Living allows you to customize your site title, site logo, custom header, background, and menu. Create your own custom header!

Page Templates

To make it easier to add variety to your site, Healthy Living offers front page template, full-width template, full-width boxed template and a grid template.

Two Custom Navigation Menus

Two custom site navigation menus are supported by Healthy Living. Primary Menu in the site header, and Social Menu in the footer. Healthy Living allows you to link to your social media profiles, like Twitter and Facebook.

Available icons

Linking to any of the following sites will automatically display its icon in your menu.

  • CodePen
  • Digg
  • Dribbble
  • Facebook
  • Flickr
  • GitHub
  • Google+
  • Instagram
  • Linkedin
  • Pinterest
  • RSS Feed (urls with /feed/)
  • Tumblr
  • Twitter
  • Vimeo
  • WordPress
  • YouTube

Post Formats

Healthy Living supports Post Formats and Sticky Posts. Style your website with aside, image, video, quote, link and gallery post formats.

Featured Images

Featured Images are displayed above the post title on the blog front page and single-post page.

Widget Areas

Healthy Living comes with three widget areas – sidebar, footer widget area and front page widget area . The widget areas will activate once you add widgets to them in Appearance → Widgets.

With the Custom Design upgrade, Healthy Living makes it easy to create your dream site by changing the fonts and colors, or adding your own custom CSS.

thestyle.name: TheStyle
thestyle.author: Elegant Themes
thestyle.description: A grid-based blog theme featuring a bold and beautiful style.
thestyle.description_long:
TheStyle is a bold and beautiful grid-based theme that displays your recent posts in animated, fluid-width layout. The design’s simple structure and photo-driven visualization of posts makes your website fun and easy to browse. TheStyle is a great theme for bloggers or news publications that want to showcase their most recent articles within a stylish design.

A Unique & Animated Design

TheStyle offers a unique and stunning design that is sure to wow your visitors. Subtle animations make browsing your website fun, and the simple grid-based layout makes browsing your website intuitive.  Furthermore, your website will always look good because TheStyle’s grid adjusts to the size of your screen automatically.

Three Widget-Ready Areas

TheStyle includes three places where you can add widgets: the footer, the index sidebar and the post-page sidebar. This allows you to include widgets on posts, but leave your homepage widget-free to give room for a beautiful, full-width display of your latest posts.

Color Customization

TheStyle supports core color options within the Theme Customizer, allowing you to easily adjust elements such as your background color and header text color.

trvl.name: Trvl
trvl.author: Automattic
trvl.description: Designed by Danny Cohen, Trvl is a beautiful and simple tumblelog theme.
trvl.description_long:
Designed by Danny Cohen, Trvl is a beautiful and simple tumblelog theme that places your posts front and center.

Post Formats

Trvl supports eight WordPress post formats — Aside, Gallery, Image, Quote, Link, Status, Audio, and Video. The appearance of posts change depending on the format you choose. This adds an element of visual interest to your blog.

Gallery
Link Format
Quote Format

Widgets

By default, Trvl appears to have no widget areas. But it actually has one – above the footer. Activate the footer widget area by going to Appearance > Widgets and adding your favorite widgets.

Custom Menu

Trvl supports one Custom Menu. The menu will appear in the footer, just above the widget area.

Header

Add a final personal touch to your website by uploading a custom header image. Trvl works best with custom header images that are 950 pixels wide and at least 250 pixels high.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

partner-mlb-retro.name: MLB "Retro"
partner-mlb-retro.author: MLB
partner-mlb-retro.description: The Official Major League Baseball “Retro” theme for WordPress.com is a throwback to old MLB Club logos and styles, for baseball fans with a sense of nostalgia. By activating this theme, you agree to the MLB terms of service.
partner-mlb-retro.description_long:
The Official Major League Baseball “Retro” theme for WordPress.com is a throwback to old MLB Club logos and styles, for baseball fans with a sense of nostalgia.

By activating this theme, you agree to the MLB terms of service and to sharing your username and email address with MLB.

tdeditor.name: tdeditor
tdeditor.author: Tasko
tdeditor.description: A responsive, clean and simple WordPress theme developed for news websites, magazines and blogs.
tdeditor.description_long:
tdEditor is a clean, simple theme suited for minimalist magazine-style sites or personal blogs. tdEditor is responsive, adapting smoothly to different screen sizes.

Custom Homepage Template

tdEditor comes with an optional custom homepage template that displays a featured content slideshow and a homepage-specific widget area.

Featured Content Slideshow

The homepage slideshow displays blog posts based on a tag that you set up in the Customizer. The slideshow displays the post’s Featured Image, title, and a short excerpt.

Custom Category Posts Widget

tdEditor features a custom widget that displays recent posts from a specific category. You can also set the number of posts you want to show per category. We recommend you use this widget with the Custom Homepage Template. The Category Posts Widget will display posts in different layouts depending on your homepage configuration: If the sidebar is not active, Homepage Category Posts will have a two-column layout. The left column will display your most recent post in the designated category, and right column will display the other posts in the category. If the sidebar is active, Homepage Category Posts will have a one-column layout. The most recent post will be display first. Other posts in the category will be shown below the most recent post.

Blog

This theme comes with two blog layouts: a two-column layout with no sidebar and a one-column layout with a sidebar.

One-Column Layout with Sidebar

This is an example of a blog page that has one-column layout and an active sidebar:

One-Column Layout Without Sidebar

Two-Column Layout

Single Blog Post

Single posts can have different layouts as well, depending on your sidebar visibility settings. If the sidebar is active then a single post looks like this: If the sidebar is not active then single posts look like this:

Breaking News Section

The Breaking News Section at the top of the page lets you highlight certain posts. You can select a special category in the Customizer for Breaking News posts.

Social Media Icons

tdEditor allows you to add social icons using a custom menu – learn how to set it up. Supported social media sites include:

  • Dribbble
  • Facebook
  • Flickr
  • GitHub
  • Google+
  • Instagram
  • LinkedIn
  • Pinterest
  • Tumblr
  • Twitter
  • YouTube
  • Behance
  • Vkontakte
  • Soundcloud
  • deviantART
  • Email

  1. The maximum content width is 760.
  2. Recommended featured image width is 1140.
  3. Recommended featured image height is at least 500.

syntax.name: Syntax
syntax.author: Automattic
syntax.description: Syntax is a theme designed with writing–and reading–in mind. With large, easy-to-read type, a fixed navigation menu, and a responsive design that looks beautiful on all screen sizes, it’s perfect for writers or bloggers who want a clean, sophisticated look and feel for their site.
syntax.description_long:
Syntax is a theme designed with writing — and reading — in mind. With large, easy-to-read type, a fixed navigation menu, and a responsive design that looks beautiful on all screen sizes, it’s perfect for writers who want a minimal design that lets their content take center stage.

Custom Menus

Syntax‘s primary menu is tucked behind a tab on the left side of the screen. Click the open menu icon to see it:

A second, single-level custom menu is located in the site’s footer:

Configure these menu areas by going to Appearance → Menus.

Connect

You can add links to your Twitter, Facebook, Google+, LinkedIn, and Tumblr accounts to your site’s header by following these steps:

  1. Connect these services to Publicize, by going to Settings → Sharing.
  2. Once connected, navigate to the Customizer, where you’ll find a new Connect panel.
  3. Select the accounts you want to link to and their respective icons will appear in the footer.

Featured Images

Post with a Featured Image

Assigning a Featured Image to your post will display the image above and behind your content on the blog archive and index.

Pull Quotes

Pull quotes can be used to highlight your content and break up large blocks of text with a unique visual treatment. Adding a class of alignleft, alignright, or aligncenter to a blockquote element, and will float the quote into the margin, or center it.

Click here for code samples, and to see Syntax’s pull quotes in action.

Widgets

Syntax supports three columns of widgets in the site’s footer. Add some widgets by going to Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Header & Background

You can personalize your site with a custom header under Appearance → Header:

The background can also be customized by going to Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 697.
  2. The footer sidebar widths are 227 each.
