notebook.name: Notebook
notebook.author: Tasko
notebook.description: Notebook is a clean and modern one-column theme ideal for bloggers of any field. Notebook makes your site’s content look amazing with a balanced typography, colors and the attention to details.
notebook.description_long:
Notebook is a clean and modern one-column theme that’s ideal for bloggers of all types. With balanced typography, colors, and attention to detail, Notebook makes the content on your site stand out.

Responsive

The theme’s design is responsive, so the content on your site will always look beautifully on smartphones, tablets, laptops, and desktop screens.

Custom Homepage Template

Notebook comes with an optional custom homepage template that displays an introduction area and recent posts section.

Introduction Section

The introduction section is the perfect way to acquaint yourself with your site’s visitors. It displays your homepage title and content along with an optional background image.

Recent Posts Section

This section displays a list of your recent posts. For each post, the title, date, author, and category name are displayed. There’s also a View All link that lets your site’s visitors quickly access the main blog page.

Sidebar

Notebook comes with a toggle sidebar that displays site’s header (logo, title, tagline and search form), custom menu, and widget area.

Featured Images

Assigning a Featured Image to your post will display it next to the post’s content in archive views and as a background image on single posts. The featured image is also used as a background for the bottom navigation linking to the next and previous posts.

Single Post Page

Archive View

Post Navigation

Social Links

Notebook allows you to add social icons using a custom menu – learn how to set it up.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The maximum content width is 820.
  2. Recommended featured image width is 1080.
  3. Recommended featured image height is at least 600.

picks.name: Staff Picks
picks.description: Determines which themes are shown in the "Choose a theme" step during signup.

bromley.name: Bromley
bromley.author: Pro Theme Design
bromley.description: The best elements of blogging themes manipulated into something beautifully simple. Ideal for local community, fan magazines, and talking about updates in your industry.
bromley.description_long:
Bromley is a flexible magazine theme for WordPress. Bromley takes the best elements of blogging themes – and manipulates them into something beautifully simple. Bromley is ideal for local community, fan magazines, and talking about updates in your industry.

Features

Accessible to All

Bromley is a fully responsive theme. What this means is that it’s designed to scale nicely with different screen sizes – all the way from a 27 inch desktop monitor down to a teeny weeny mobile phone screen – everything is kept readable and beautiful, allowing your readers to access the site from anywhere.

Custom Menu

Through the power of WordPress custom menu system Bromley gives you full control over the site menu. Or if you want it to be automated then your sites pages are displayed by default. What’s more, on large screens, the menu (and the site title) remain fixed at the top of the page. this gives your readers an easy, consistent way to navigate around the site – hopefully keeping them there longer increasing both your branding and your page views.

Featured Content

Bromley makes use of the WordPress Featured Content functionality. This allows you to tag your posts with a tag you define and then have them display more prominently in the theme. To make use of them simply select the post tag you want to use and enter it on the “Appearance → Customize → Featured Content” page in the Featured Content area. Then, just tag up the posts you want to be flagged as special and Bromley will make the most of them. As you can see in the screenshot below – the Featured content looks great when it has a Featured Image selected.

Widgets

Bromley supports 3 sets of custom widgets. Widgets are a powerful addition that allow you to add and arrange all sorts of flexible content containers to your site. For example you can display a list of your latest posts, or display your blogs latest comments.

Of the 3 sets of widgets – 2 are available in the right hand sidebar, and one in the footer. If you decide you don’t want any of the widget areas then you can simply leave them empty and the theme will automatically rearrange itself to take this into account.

In the case of the sidebar widgets – the first sidebar will display on the homepage, the second will display on the blog post pages. This gives you full control of your website content – allowing you to structure things however you wish. If you remove the widgets making the sidebar empty then Bromley will make the rest of the site content wider bringing a stronger focus to your content. This powerful addition allows you to layout your site however you like.

Custom Headers and Backgrounds

Bromley gives you the ability to upload your own header images via Appearance → Header. You can also customize your blog with a background color or image by going to Appearance → Background.

Custom Colours

If you have the wordpress.com Custom Design upgrade then you can freely change the colours on your Bromley powered theme. Below are some screenshots showing the flexibility of this system.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. At full width the main column width is 863 pixels wide.
  2. With sidebar widgets setup the main column content width is 667 pixels wide.
  3. The sidebar width is 313 pixels wide.
  4. Please keep in mind that this theme is responsive, which means that it changes size as the browser is re-sized.
  5. The post thumbnails (on the homepage) are 261 pixels wide – their height changes based upon the content of the article.

eight.name: Eight
eight.author: Automattic
eight.description: Featuring a design by renowned web designer Elliot Jay Stocks, Eight will transform the look of your blog. Even better, Eight’s custom highlight color feature, custom background, and custom header, let you transform it right back and easily create your own blog design.
eight.description_long:
Featuring a design by renowned web designer Elliot Jay Stocks, Eight will transform the look of your blog. Even better, Eight’s custom highlight color feature, custom background, and custom header, let you transform it right back and easily create your own blog design.

Change Up Your Design

By taking advantage of the different options at Appearance → Theme Options (to change the theme highlight color), Appearance → Background (to add a custom background), and at Appearance → Header (to add a custom header image just above the content), you can easily make Eight look like it’s wearing your own custom theme.

Check Eight out. It might be the perfect theme for your blog!

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 498.
  2. The sidebar width is 178.
  3. The custom header size is 538 by 238.

Eight theme documentation

oxford.name: Oxford
oxford.author: The Theme Foundry
oxford.description: A magazine style theme with Typekit fonts and multicolumn layouts.
oxford.description_long:
Typography matters.

Typekit® fonts built right in.

Your stories deserve the best in design, aesthetics, and typography. That’s why we partnered with Typekit to bring you Oxford, the first ever WordPress theme to include a Typekit font right out of the box. No Typekit account required. Oxford features Soleil for the main body copy and Futura PT for the headlines. It’s the perfect contemporary font combination for your magazine or blog.

Please note: Oxford comes with one year of WordPress.com’s Custom Design upgrade included in the cost. The Custom Design upgrade gives you access to the special Typekit fonts, as well as color options and the ability to modify the theme’s CSS.

While Oxford itself is a one-time purchase, the Custom Design upgrade is a yearly upgrade that must be renewed separately after the first year. Its cost is $30.00 per year. If you choose not to renew the Custom Design upgrade after the first year, the theme will no longer be displayed with Soleil and Futura PT.

Make it your own.

Add some custom styling.

Personalizing your new website should be fun. We’ve leveraged the built-in Customizer, so adding your own custom logo and social links is easy. We’ve also included an extra option for setting the background color on individual posts or pages. This is a great way to add a splash of relevant color to one of your stories.

Quality construction.

Rock solid responsive layouts.

Oxford leverages the latest in web design technology to ensure your new site looks polished and professional across desktop screens, tablets, and phones. CSS3 columns and Masonry.js work together to form a solid foundation for the responsive layout. We’ve also performance tested and optimized the CSS and the JavaScripts, ensuring they load quickly and efficiently for your visitors.

Adapts to your content.

Switch themes. Get back to work.

Oxford brings a new adaptive approach that keeps your site looking professional with your existing content. No images, no problem. Lots of images, we’ve got you covered. The homepage template can display custom content, a featured post, or the most recent post. Individual blog posts and archive pages automatically adapt to the length and style of your content.

Help and additional information

If you need help with Oxford be sure to read through the Oxford documentation by clicking the Support button at the top of the sidebar on this page. You can also ask us questions in the WordPress.com Oxford support forum.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  • Featured images should have a minimum width of 900.
  • For two featured images, the minimum width for each is 450.
  • The main column maximum width is 900.
  • All images and video will scale to fit the viewing screen.

blogly.name: Blogly
blogly.author: ThemeFurnace
blogly.description: Blogly is a clean, flat design theme for personal bloggers.
blogly.description_long:
Blogly is a clean, flat-design theme for personal blogs that makes use of Post Formats to highlight different kinds of content. It supports Site Logos and includes a social media menu, along with a Dribbble widget so you can show off your latest shots.

Responsive Design

Blogly was built to look good on any size screen. It resizes to fit mobile phones and tablets, and looks great on desktop displays as well.

Custom Images

Blogly includes the Site Logo feature and supports Custom Headers and Custom Backgrounds, so you can personalize your site with your own branding.

Dribbble Widget

Display any number of your latest Dribbble shots in the sidebar with our custom widget.

Social Links Menu

Show off your social media accounts in the sidebar with a Social Links menu. Simply create a menu with your links and Blogly will add the corresponding icon.

Post Formats

Blogly uses of Post Formats — choose what type of content you’re posting, and it will style the post accordingly.

kent.name: Kent
kent.author: Pro Theme Design
kent.description: Kent is a clean WordPress theme designed for writers who want to focus on writing content. It’s the perfect theme for people who want to tell stories. Kent includes custom header, social links, and footer widget options to allow you to lay out your site exactly as you wish.
kent.description_long:
Kent is a responsive theme designed for writers who want to write. Stripped back to the minimum — it’s designed to work well on all internet-enabled devices.

Features

Custom Menu

To keep things clean and simple, the menu in Kent is hidden — however it’s only a single click to open it up and browse the site. The expandable menu was made as flexible as possible to allow for both long and short menus. It also includes a search box to give readers another means to navigate your site. By default, the custom menu displays the websites pages – but if you want more control you can use WordPress built in custom menus.

Kent Menu Demo

Custom Header Image and Colours

Kent uses custom header images in quite a unique way. On wider screens it is a vertical block, filling the height of the page. On mobile devices, it switches to a horizontal block and sits at the top of the page.

Kent includes a collection of header images for you to select from — or if you prefer you can upload your own header image as well.

Social Accounts

Kent allows you to add links to your Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, and Tumblr accounts. To make use of this you must first, connect these services to Publicize, by going to Settings → Sharing. Once connected, navigate to the Customizer, where you’ll find a new Connect panel. Select the account(s) you want to link to, and their respective icons will be displayed.

Footer Widgets

Kent supports one widget area, which can be seen at the bottom of each page. Widgets are a powerful addition that allow you to add all sorts of flexible content containers to your site. For example you can display a list of your latest posts, or display your latest comments. You can also add text and image widgets to personalize your site further.

Author Byline

At the bottom of each blog post is the author byline. This is a block that displays the author’s Gravatar and biography (which you can edit from each author’s user profile page).

Example Uses

Kent is perfect for all sorts of websites, below are a few examples of how the theme could be used in different situations.

Business Blog

Kent would be great for a business blog — giving you the ability to tell your customers about your latest products and company updates. It also gives you space to market content that is appropriate for your audience. The custom header image can include your company logo (we recommend placing the logo in the middle of the image) or it could include an image of your product. Likewise, use the Custom Design upgrade to tie the Kent theme into your brand’s styles.

The navigation will stay out of the way — but since it uses custom menus, you can add a link to your main website. The author byline space can give your customers a bit more information about the people in your company, creating a human face for the business.

Finally, you could link to your business social media accounts through the social link settings. This would have the added benefit of allowing you to automatically share your blog posts when you publish new content.

Author’s Journal

As your online home and marketing tool, Kent would be an ideal space for promoting yourself online. As an author, you could post short stories as well as articles about your craft and latest projects.

By using custom colors, you can let your personality shine while still keeping things professional. For that added connection with your readers, add a photo of yourself to the custom header.

Kent’s focus on clean typography and simplicity makes it clear that writing is your specialty. The larger than average font size ensures that everybody can read what you’re writing.

The social connection options are a great way to market yourself — and you could make use of the footer widgets to add some testimonials and links to reviews of your writing to help drum up additional sales of your books and enhance your online reputation.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. At full width the main column width is 656.
  2. Please keep in mind that this theme is responsive, which means that it changes size as the browser is re-sized.
  3. The post thumbnails (on the homepage) are 160 pixels wide by 160 pixels high.
  4. In modern browsers the thumbnails are turned into circles – which means content at the corner of the images may be cropped. All featured images are generated from the same initial image so make sure to keep the focus of the image in the center as the surrounding content may be cropped.

chalk.name: Chalk
chalk.author: The Theme Foundry
chalk.description: An innovative WordPress theme for the twenty-first century teacher. Specially crafted to bring the classroom environment online, the theme includes some exciting features: to-do lists, class conversations, podcasts and video lectures.
chalk.description_long:
By The Theme Foundry

Get creative.

Help others learn.

We built Chalk for bloggers, creatives, and teachers. It starts with readable typography on a clean and responsive layout. You’ve got several different options for sharing and teaching at your finger tips. Post lesson lists. Share a syllabus or a class schedule. Track a group to-do list. Review a discussion. We’ve even included an optional print link with any post or page. All the tools are in place. Just add your materials and start sharing.

Add some style.

Make it your own.

Personalizing your new website should be fun. We’ve leveraged the built-in WordPress customizer, so adding your own background image or color is easy. On top of that, we’ve included seven hand selected font options. You can also set your own primary color for links and buttons with the built in color picker. Combine these fonts and colors with a custom background to give your website a truly unique look.

Watch. Listen. Read.

Share with your audience.

Chalk makes it simple to post any type of content: videos, quotes, links, status updates, asides, images, galleries, audio files, and even chats. Each format has a unique style, tailored to the media you post. Your audience will enjoy watching video, listening to music, and reading articles on your website.

Help and additional information

If you need help with Chalk be sure to read through the documentation by clicking the Support button at the top of the sidebar on this page. You can also ask us questions in the WordPress.com Chalk support forum.

Looking to buy Chalk for a self hosted WordPress.org website? The Theme Foundry builds WordPress templates for WordPress.org and you can purchase the Chalk theme for WordPress.org directly from their website.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. Chalk is a flexible-width, responsive design.
  2. The main column maximum width is 760.
  3. Featured images are 760 by 300.
  4. All images will scale to fit the viewing screen.

poly.name: Poly
poly.author: Automattic
poly.description: A colorful theme with a dynamic grid layout
poly.description_long:
Poly is a colorful theme featuring a dynamic grid layout, perfect for a virtual scrapbook.

Optimal layout on different media devices

Poly is responsive — from desktop to mobile, and everything in between. The design will adapt to any screen without sacrificing usability, your site’s design, and most importantly, your content.

Full-width template

Poly comes with a full-width page template to put the focus on your content.

Post format support

Poly supports multiple post formats, including aside, image, video, quote, link, gallery, and audio. Each post format has a special style to distinguish it from the rest.

Featured images

Want to highlight your visual content? Consider adding a featured image to your posts (using the “standard” post format), and pages. Featured images appear above the content on the blog index and on single pages.

Connect to social networks

Poly allows you to add links to your Twitter and Facebook accounts in the theme’s header. First, connect these services to Publicize, by going to Settings → Sharing. Once connected, navigate to the Customizer, where you will find a new Connect panel. Select the account(s) you want to link to, and their respective icons will be displayed:

Custom menus, header, and background

Poly allows you to have a custom menu in the theme’s header. It can be setp up by going to Appearance → Menus.

It also lets you choose a custom header image. Simply go to Appearance → Header and set your new header.

And finally, you can easily apply a background color or image by going to Appearance → Background.

Theme options

Poly comes packed with multiple theme options available via the Customizer:

  • Full-page background image: allow your background image to cover the whole page and stay fixed.
  • Search form: display a search form in the theme’s header.
  • Post author: display the author’s name underneath each post.
  • Sidebar position: you can choose to display the sidebar either on the left or on right (default).

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 580 except in the full-width layout where it’s 900.
  2. The sidebar width is 260.
  3. A widget area in the footer is 300.

simfo.name: Simfo
simfo.author: Automattic
simfo.description: Simfo has a sharp looking minimal style perfect for photographers.
simfo.description_long:
With a strong minimal aesthetic embellished with subtle hints of grunge, Simfo will direct
your visitors’ focus on what matters most; your content. This theme was built from the ground up to support screen sizes from small to large. Ensuring that your site will look great while on the go.

Featured Content Section

Give special attention to select posts by adding them to the featured content section. The featured content section will display on your site’s front page directly above the post content.

To enable this section:

  1. Navigate to Settings → Reading.
  2. Scroll down to the section labeled “Featured Content”.
  3. Enter the name of a tag.
  4. Click the blue “Save Changes” button at the bottom.

Once a tag name has been saved, posts having this tag will appear in the featured content section. You can specify an image to be displayed with each post by setting a featured image.

Grid Layout

If your front page is set to show recent posts, Simfo will use the grid layout shown in the image above. In the event that you use a static page to display recent posts, a blog style layout will be used instead. Note: posts tagged for the featured content section will not appear in the grid layout.

Featured Images

Simfo’s grid-style layout relies heavily on featured images, and looks best when you assign one to each of your posts. You can do this using the Featured Image meta box when you create or edit a post.

If no featured image is assigned, Simfo will attempt to pull the first attached image in your post. Find out how to attach an image to your post here.

If no image is attached, the theme displays a light gray placeholder. Placeholders will not be shown when view on smaller screens.

Custom Menu

The Primary Menu is located at the top of the theme directly under your site’s title and tagline. It can be configured by going to Appearance -> Menus.

Custom Header

Simfo supports a flexible height and width custom header image, which can be configured under Appearance -> Header.

Custom Background

Spruce up your site with a custom background color or image by going to Appearance -> Background.

Widgets

Simfo provides 5 total widget areas grouped into 3 sections:

  1. Sidebar: Displays in post, page, archive, and search templates.
  2. Front Page: Displays in the front page template below the featured content area.
  3. Footer: Displays above the footer in all templates.

You can configure these areas by navigating to Appearance -> Widgets while logged in.

Please note: Front Page sidebar is not compatible when your Front Page is set to “latests posts”.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 633 except in the full-width layout where it’s 980.
  2. The sidebar width is 253.
  3. The suggested header image size is 980 wide by 240 tall.
  4. The suggested image size for the featured content section is 980 wide by 415 tall.
  5. The suggested image size for the grid layout is 400 wide by 240 tall.

awesome.name: Awesome
awesome.author: Graph Paper Press
awesome.description: A super wide, neat, fullscreen theme to showcase Photos, Galleries and Videos!
awesome.description_long:
Awesome is a simple and compact design that will make your content king. The design of Awesome intentionally fades into the background and allows your images, videos and text will take center stage. Awesome includes support for six post formats: Standard, Aside, Image, Gallery and Quote. Awesome is natively responsive, meaning it adapts to different screen sizes so that your website will work (and be optimized for) iPhones, iPads and other mobile devices. Here are the major features included in Awesome:

Awesome Slideshows

Awesome includes a full-page-width gallery slideshow layout, which we’ve creatively named “Awesome Slideshow”. To create an “Awesome Slideshow”, upload some images, create a gallery and select the “Awesome slideshow” layout type, which appears at the right under the Gallery Settings section. Here is a screenshot showing the location of the setting.

Post Formats

Post formats allow you to customize the presentation of a post. Awesome includes support for six post formats: Standard, Aside, Image, Gallery, Video and Quote. Here is an example of each post format layout:

Standard

Only the post content is shown on standard post formats. The example above includes an image inserted into the post with text below. If you set a featured image, it will sit atop the post, similar to the image post format layout, which is shown below.

Image

The image post format layout includes the featured image above the post title and is displayed across the entire page.

Gallery

Gallery post formats are by far the most versatile of all the post formats included in the Awesome theme. When you assign a post to the “gallery” post format and you have inserted a gallery into the page, the layout changes dramatically depending on the exact type of gallery you’ve chosen to insert. In addition to the “Awesome slideshow” option, which is shown above, WordPress.com includes the following gallery types: Thumbnail Grid, Tiled Mosaic, Square Tiles, Circles and Slideshow.

Aside

Posts assigned to the “aside” post format are displayed with a cool blue background. The post title isn’t shown, since the whole purpose of “aside” post formats are supposed to resemble a Facebook note update.

Quote

The post content is shown above a large, semi-transparent quote and vibrant yellow background for posts assigned to the quote post format.

Responsive

Awesome includes a native responsive layout that adapts to the different screen sizes of devices like iPhone, iPad, Android, etc. If you prefer the native responsive layout over the default mobile version served by WordPress.com, simply disable the mobile version on your settings page and let Awesome’s responsive layout take over from there.

Theme Customizer

Customize colors, add a logo, change header images and background images and preview your changes live on the page.

Custom Headers

Add a customer header image to the top of the site. You can also change the color of the text that overlays the header image. You can use the default header image or upload one of your own. Header images should be sized at 1280 px wide by 500 px tall. The site logo appears in an overlay in this header image area, followed by your site description. All the interior single pages/posts will use the Featured Image as the Header image on the top. There is a theme option for showing only one custom header image on all interior pages if you want to change that behavior (disabled by default). Visit the Appearance -> Theme Options page to change this.

Custom Backgrounds

Visit the Appearance -> Background to select your preferred background color – or upload a custom background image.

Widgets

Awesome has three widgetized areas: Footer Left, Footer Center, Footer Right. Add widgets to all, some, or none of the widgetized areas to customize the layout.

Menus

Awesome uses WordPress’s custom menus option. These can be created in Appearance > Menus.

You can add social media icons to your menu. This theme supports the following custom icons— Home, About, Contact, Portfolio, Photo, Video, Dribble, Facebook, Twitter, Vimeo, Pinterest, Google Plus, WordPress, Flickr and Instagram.

In your Menus panel on your dashboard, click on the arrow for each menu item to open the details box. You should see an option for “CSS Classes”. If you do not see this option, click the “Screen Options” link at the top of the page and make sure “CSS Classes” is checked in the menu that opens up.

To specify which icon will display, enter the corresponding class name in the CSS Classes box. Please note that these class names are case sensitive. The corresponding class names are: home, about, contact, portfolio, photo, video, dribble, facebook, twitter, vimeo, pinterest, googleplus, wordpress, flickr and instagram.

This is an example of a correctly completed menu details section.

bon-vivant.name: Bon Vivant
bon-vivant.author: Automattic
bon-vivant.description: An eclectic theme for food blogs and restaurants.
bon-vivant.description_long:
Bon Vivant is a quirky, illustrated theme with special features for restaurants and cafés. With a unique custom header information area, food menus support, Open Table registration widget, and a prominent space for your phone number, Bon Vivant will help get your restaurant business up and running in no time!

Custom Header Image & Header Sidebar

Bon Vivant includes a Header Sidebar widget area that is only visible when a Custom Header image is active. Use this space to show off your most visually tempting dishes alongside the helpful information your patrons need, like contact or reservation information. To set up the header:

  1. Add a custom header image under Appearance → Header. Consider adding multiple header images and selecting “random” for more variety!
  2. Assign widgets to the Header Sidebar area under Appearance → Widgets. This is a small area, so one or two brief widgets work best.
  3. You’ll now see the header image with the widgets overlaid on top, like so:

Reserve by Phone

Add your phone number in a special flag alongside the header menu by going to Customizer → Theme Options.

Reserve Online

Using OpenTable? Grab your HTML code from OpenTable and add it to either sidebar using the OpenTable widget. You can also set up a Contact Form to take reservations via email.

Food Menus

Add your delicious food menus all at once, or edit them on the fly by going to Food Menus in your Dashboard. Changing the order of items in the menu is as easy as dragging and dropping them up and down.

After you’ve added food menu items, simply create a new page with the Menu page template, under Page Attributes.

Voila! You now have beautiful food menus. If you’ve added featured images to your food items, they’ll appear alongside the menu title and description.

Want to offer a downloadable copy of your menu? No problem. Upload a PDF version from Theme Options in the Customizer, and the menu page will display a download button on the top right of the menu page’s title spot:

Custom Menus

Bon Vivant includes two Custom Menus, highlighted below, configured under Appearance → Menus.

The header menu is located above the site title and description, and supports up to 3 levels of menu items. If no menu is assigned, this area will display a list of your Pages:

The optional footer menu is displayed just above the website’s footer credits, and supports one level of menu items:

Full-width Page Template

Remove the sidebar on select pages by applying the Full Width, No Sidebar page template under Page Attributes.

Custom Backgrounds

You can add your own background to Bon Vivant by going to Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 625, except in the full-width template, where it is 940
  2. The sidebar width is 225
  3. The featured images for food menu items are 115 square.

bexley.name: Bexley
bexley.author: Pro Theme Design
bexley.description: Bexley is a photo blog – placing the photos at the forefront and giving you plenty of space to add your own writing around them.
bexley.description_long:
Bexley is a photo oriented theme. Bexley is the perfect combination of imagery and text – and it gives photographers and artists a space to user as their online portfolio or gallery. Bexley would also be a great choice for companies that work in a visual medium – such as movies or video games.

Features

Accessible to All

Bexley is a fully responsive theme. What this means is that it’s designed to scale nicely with different screen sizes – all the way from a 27 inch desktop monitor down to a tablet or smartphone screen – everything is kept readable and beautiful, allowing your readers to access the site from anywhere.

Featured Images

Bexley makes prominent use of WordPress featured images to personalize every post. On the homepage and archive pages the images are used as the background for the post listing – with the post title prominently displayed. The featured images are also displayed at the top of each post on the single post pages. This makes the theme great as a portfolio or showcase of visual work.

Custom Menu

By default Bexley displays your blogs pages in the navigation, however if you want more flexibility then it also makes full use of WordPress custom menu functions to give you full control over the site menu.

Widgets

Bexley supports 2 sets of custom widgets. Widgets are a powerful addition that allow you to add and arrange all sorts of flexible content containers to your site. For example you can display a list of your latest posts, or display your blogs latest comments.

The 2 sets of custom widgets are available in the right hand sidebar, and in the footer. If you decide you don’t want either of the widget areas then you can simply leave them empty and Bexley will automatically adjust content widths and positions to keep things looking nice.

Custom Headers and Backgrounds

Bexley gives you the ability to upload your own header images via Appearance → Header. You can also customize your blog with a background color or image by going to Appearance → Background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. At full width the main column width is 902 pixels wide.
  2. The sidebar width is 313 pixels wide.
  3. Please keep in mind that this theme is responsive, which means that it changes size as the browser is re-sized.
  4. The post thumbnails (on the homepage) are 261 pixels wide – their height changes based upon the content of the article.

delight.name: Delight
delight.author: CyberChimps Inc
delight.description: A responsive, mobile friendly theme with the ability to add contact details and links to your social network profiles in the header. Other design customizations include the choice between a left- or right-sidebar, and the ability to display custom menus in both the header and the footer.
delight.description_long:
Delight is a clean tablet- and phone-friendly blogging theme that offers simple, effective customization options.

Contact Information

Make it easy for your users to get in touch! Add your phone number, address, and email address by going to Appearance → Customizer → Theme Options. This contact information will appear in your header, just below the header navigation menu.

Address Display

Social Interaction

When you activate your Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Tumbler, and Google+ profiles using Publicize, you can choose to display social icons in your header address bar so that your readers can follow you.

Social profile icon display

Choice of Left or Right Sidebar

Delight comes with one widget area. You can choose to display this widget area in either the left or right sidebar by going to Appearance → Customizer → Theme Options.

Left Sidebar
Right Sidebar

Featured Images

Spice up your front page by assigning featured images to your posts. For best results, featured images should be 848 pixels wide by 300 pixels tall.

Custom menu, header and background

Delight also supports two custom menus (one in the header and one in the footer), custom headers, and a custom background.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column maximum width is 640, with a responsive layout throughout.
  2. The featured image works best with images at least 848 wide and 300 high.
  3. The sidebars are 263 wide.

ladder.name: Ladder
ladder.author: Viva Themes
ladder.description: Ladder is a visually striking theme with a modern, flat design that ensures you present yourself and your company professionally. With Ladder, you can showcase your work and identity in a unique way.
ladder.description_long:
Ladder is a visually striking theme with a modern, flat design that ensures you present yourself and your company professionally. With Ladder, you can showcase your work and identity in a unique way.

Different Backgrounds

One of Ladder‘s important features is the way it uses Featured Images — each Featured Image is displayed as a background to its page or post.

On the background of the front page of your site, you can also embed a YouTube video or an image slideshow.

Responsive Design

Ladder comes with a fluid layout that adapts to devices of any size, keeping its design and features intact.

Front Page Layout

You can have your latest posts, a static page, or a text widget displayed on the front page. Ladder offers lots of flexibility while maintaining a clean look.

Portfolio

Ladder takes advantage of the Portfolio feature, allowing you to showcase your work easily and attractively. Learn how to activate and configure the portfolio.

Social Media Icons

Ladder allows you to link to your social media profiles, like Twitter and Facebook; 11 different social media services are supported.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  • The main column width is 670.
  • Featured Images in the portfolio are 500 square.

antenna.name: Antenna
antenna.author: DesignOrbital
antenna.description: Antenna is a responsive and beautiful magazine theme for all those who need a great looking website. Antenna is focused on clean and modern design that supports boxed and full width layout. It is really easy to setup via theme customizer.
antenna.description_long:
Antenna is a responsive and beautiful magazine theme for all those who need a great-looking website. Antenna is a clean and modern design that supports fixed or full-width layouts.

The theme is perfect for news and magazine websites, as well as blogs. It’s easy to set up via the Customizer.

Responsive Design

Antenna is 100% responsive, guaranteed to look great on large-resolution desktop screens, as well as mobile devices, including tablets, cellphones, and others. All contemporary browsers supported, too!

Featured Post Slider

Want to highlight your content? Consider using Featured Content to tag your posts and add them to the slider on the homepage.

Featured Images

Featured Images are displayed to the left of the excerpt on the home and archive pages. On single pages, these are displayed under the post title.

Post Formats & Sticky Posts

Antenna supports Post Formats and Sticky Posts. Aside, Audio, Gallery, Image, Link, Quote, and Video post formats give your website a beautiful look.

Post Carousel Widget

Antenna comes with the Post Carousel widget to enhance your sidebar. This widget displays posts from all or one specific category.

Post List Widget

Antenna includes a Post List widget to enhance your sidebar. This widget displays posts in a list with a beautiful thumbnail alongside the post title and date from all or one specific category.

Blog Layouts

Antenna is powered with different blog layouts. You can choose the following layouts easily via the Customizer.

  • Sidebar/Content Layout
  • Content/Sidebar Layout

Theme Layouts

You can use Antenna with the default wide layout or personalize it with beautiful backgrounds using the boxed layout via the Customizer.

Full-Width Page Template

Antenna comes with a Full-Width Page Template to put the focus on your content without a sidebar.

Custom Header and Background

You can personalize your site with a custom header and background via the Customizer.

Custom Menus

Antenna allows you to have a Custom Menu that can be set up by going to Appearance → Menus.

Widget Areas

Antenna comes with four widget areas — one in the right or left sidebar, and up to three in the footer. The footer widget areas will activate once you drag widgets to them in Appearance → Widgets.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The main column width is 714.
  2. The sidebar width is 325.
  3. Full width is 1140.
  4. Featured Images are 380 by 290 on the homepage and archive pages, and 730 by 550 on single posts and pages.
  5. Featured Slider Images are 720 by 385.

inspiration-laboratory.name: Inspiration Laboratory
inspiration-laboratory.author: Automattic
inspiration-laboratory.description: A playful, colorful personal blogging theme with exclusive artwork by Dima Je
inspiration-laboratory.description_long:
Inspiration Laboratory is a quirky, playful design with colorful, personable cartoons, a functional three-column layout, and support for several Post Formats — a great choice for a tumblelog or personal site.

Post Formats

Inspiration Laboratory supports the Aside, Image, Video, Quote, Link, Gallery, and Audio Post Formats, allowing you to easily create a tumblelog of your favorite finds. Each supported Post Format has a special icon or style to distinguish it from the rest.

An example of the « Image » post format

Theme Options

This fun theme includes an optional character avatar in the secondary sidebar, which can be selected under Customizer → Theme Options. Choose your favorite character from the figures below, or remove the avatar entirely by selecting « None. »

Connect

Inspiration Laboratory also allows you to add links to your Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Tumblr accounts to the theme’s secondary sidebar:

Custom Colors

Inspiration Laboratory is designed to work seamlessly with Custom Colors and the Custom Design upgrade. Yellow not your style? We’ve included a few featured color palettes to inspire you, or you can choose your own:


Featured Images

Want to highlight your visual content? Consider adding a Featured Image to your posts! Featured images appear above the content on the blog index and archives:

Custom Headers

Inspiration Laboratory comes with twelve default header images in a variety of character styles. Pick the one that best fits your mood, or randomize them for a different header each time you visit your site!

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 492 except in the full-width layout where it’s 952.
  2. The sidebar widths are 200 each.

espresso.name: Espresso
espresso.author: Automattic
espresso.description: A sophisticated, responsive portfolio theme designed by Justin Caroll, perfect for showcasing your work. With a convenient slide-out sidebar, bold featured images, and quick access to your favorite social networks, Espresso will make your portfolio stand out from the rest.
espresso.description_long:
Espresso is a responsive, content-centric theme that lets you choose between two charming layouts. Go with a traditional post stream for your writing-based blog, or go grid-style for your photography blog. A fixed sidebar on the right keeps widgets, menus, and social links at the ready for visitors.

Grid View/Post Navigation

Readers can opt to browse your posts in a sophisticated grid rather than a list – a great option for portfolio sites with lots of Featured Images – by clicking on the grid icon in the site navigation.

You can also use the navigation arrows on either side of the grid icon to scroll to the next or previous post.

Portfolio

Espresso takes advantage of the Portfolio feature on WordPress.com, offering unique layouts and organization for your portfolio projects. Learn how to enable and set up this exciting Portfolio feature.

Site Logo

Brand your site and make it yours by including your business’ logo; navigate to Customize → Site Title and upload a logo image in the space provided.

Responsive Design

Espresso looks beautiful on any device at any screen size, so your readers get the best viewing experience no matter what.

Featured Images

Espresso looks its best when you assign a Featured Image to your posts. Featured Images appear above the post title, or as a background to the post information in grid view. We recommend images that are a minimum of 1440 px wide by 550 px tall to get a clear, crisp picture.

Social Links

You can add links to a multitude of social services in the site navigation bar or under the main navigation area. Supported networks include Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, and many more.

Custom Menus & Widgets

Espresso’s primary Custom Menu and widget area are located in a hidden panel off-screen, ensuring your secondary content is easily accessible with the click of a button.

 

Add your own Custom Menu by going to Appearance → Menus, or add widgets by going to Appearance → Widgets.

Custom Header & Background

Take it a step further and personalize your site with a custom header or background image.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 760.
  2. The pull-out menu/sidebar area width is 200.
  3. Featured Images and Custom Headers must be at least 1440 wide by 550 high.
  4. The Site Logo will appear at a maximum of 175 high.

clear-news.name: Clear News
clear-news.author: Press75
clear-news.description: Clear News was designed to get out of the way and provide a medium for your users to easily access your content on any device.
clear-news.description_long:
Clear News is a well-crafted, responsive theme for your blog, news, or magazine website.

Clear News’ homepage features a bold full-width Featured Image above a grid of your latest posts, showcasing your most important articles. The theme’s homepage grid highlights photos and videos, while allowing easily social media sharing. It includes a unique slide-out menu for ultimate versatility for all users, across any device. A slide-out sidebar easily displays unique content with the click of a mouse or the tap of a finger. The theme is compatible with Vimeo and YouTube for displaying your latest videos, with a simple location for you to paste in your video URL. The theme features several options for easy customization and you can easily display your Facebook, Twitter, and Google+ links below the menu button.

Whether you’re a casual blogger, dedicated news provider, or just looking to showcase your images and videos on WordPress.com — Clear News is a wonderful choice!

Responsive Layout

Clear News features a fully responsive layout — so your photos, videos, and text will display beautifully across mobile devices. All you need to do is add your content and the theme will display it properly for you.

Lovely Typography

Clear News looks lovely thanks to Merriweather, a modern serif font that closely harmonizes with the weights and styles of the entire serif family. Everything from titles to paragraph text has been optimized for a comfortable reading experience on all devices.

Menus and Navigation

Clear News features a slide-out menu that you can open and close by clicking or tapping the button in the upper-left hand corner of the browser window. The menu includes a search field for your site visitors to easily use to search your site. Clear News’ menu is mimicked with the slide-out drawer feature of the sidebar on the right side of the browser window. Within single posts, the Clear News theme allows easy next and previous arrow navigation.

Other Cool Things About Clear News

Clear News also supports Custom Backgrounds, Custom Menus, Widgets, and a Full-Width Page Template.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels):

  1. The homepage top full-width image should be at least 1024.
  2. The post/article featured image width is 1140.
  3. The sidebar widget area width is 300.

everyday.name: Everyday
everyday.author: Automattic
everyday.description: Precisely calibrated to be pleasurably readable on almost any screen. Attention and care has especially been given to providing a robust and versatile layout to suit your writing needs. From short quips to lengthier bits of prose, Everyday will rise to the challenge and shine with every post you publish.
everyday.description_long:
Everyday has been precisely calibrated to be pleasurably readable on almost any screen. Attention and care has especially been given to provide a robust and versatile layout to suit your writing needs. From short quips to lengthier bits of prose, Everyday will rise to the challenge and shine with every post you publish.

Header

The header section displays above the sidebar on the right side of the template. You may choose to upload a custom header image with a width of 250 pixels. You are able to adjust the height of the image to your taste immediately after you upload it.

Custom Menu

A custom menu will appear below the header and many contain as many links as you like. You can customize the list of links displayed here by navigating to Appearance → Menus. If no menu is configured, this section will display a list of published pages. Nested menu items are supported three levels deep and will always be displayed.

Widgets

There is a single widget area which displays directly below the menu section in the right-hand sidebar. Navigate to Appearance → Widgets to customize this section.

Images, Blockquotes, and Video

Images, blockquotes, videos, and many shortcodes will appear larger than surrounding content. For a stunning effect, upload and image that is 690 pixels wide or larger and it will appear to break out of the content on both the left and right-hand sides. Thinner images will appear to be pulled to the left. You can also choose “Right” under the Alignment section of the Add Media screen and the image will appear pulled to the right. Read more about image alignment.

Archive Display

Date, category, and tag archive pages are designed in a very minimal fashion. Only the post’s title and the date it was posted will be displayed here.

Quick Specs (all measurements in pixels)

  1. The main column width is 690.
  2. The sidebar width is 250.

Everyday theme documentation
